Description: Having escaped from Hong Kong, the five gatekeepers - Matt, Pedro, Scott, Jamie and Scarlett - are scattered in a hostile and dangerous world. As they struggle to re-group and plan their next move, the malevolent King of the Old Ones gathers his forces in Oblivion: a desolate landscape where the last survivors of humanity must fight the ultimate battle.
Subtitle: Oblivion
Title: Power of Five
Author: Anthony Horowitz

Description:
Shaggy: 14 rather amusing rambles is a collection of hilarious short monologues by a cast of self indulgent, idiotic misanthropes whose speeches are full of sound and fury, signifying very little.

The stories follow 14 peculiar characters as they operate in contemporary South Africa: prepare yourself for a woman addicted to washing dishes, a satanist trying to sell timeshare, and a marketing manager, explaining the supernatural qualities of baked beans!

LitNet describes Shaggy as the "kind of laughter that makes your abdominal muscles (that you didn’t know existed) contract and contort and your cheeks start to tickle with tears of joy."
Subtitle: 14 rather amusing rambles
Title: Shaggy
Author: Anton Krueger; Pravasan Pillay

Description: Filled with fascinating facts, this series looks at the extraordinary animals living in southern Africa. Discover the amazing adaptations that animals have developed in order to survive. Find out about their lifecycles, the places they live, why some keep territories, why they migrate or hibernate, how they find a mate and escape predators, and how they interact with one another.\r\n\r\nThe sections on conservation matters and animal classification introduce new ways of thinking. Full-colour photographs, beautiful illustrations, fun activities, and informative text will help you understand what the lives of these animals are all about.
Subtitle: Birds

Description: From his high pedestal, the Happy Prince, a magnificent golden statue, can see all the misery of the city below him. He begs a little Swallow to pluck off his treasure and share it amongst the poor. When the Happy Prince asks his new friend to stay and help him, the Swallow receives a lesson in kindness and caring.\r\n\r\nOscar Wilde’s timeless, compassionate tale of the friendship between the Happy Prince and the Swallow is brought to life by Joan Rankin’s sensitive, magical artwork. Beloved since it was first published in 1888, this enchanting story will be enjoyed by both adults and children.
Subtitle: null
Title: The Happy Prince
Author: Carole Bloch; Margaret Sixel

Description: Njengoba emi phezu kwensika ephakeme nje, uMntanenkosi Othokozile, isichuse esiphambili ngempela esenziwe ngegolide, ukwazi ukubona lonke usizi olutholakala edolobheni elilaphaya phansi. Usecela iNkonjane encane ukuba ide ikhipha leli gugu elisemzimbeni wakhe ukuze abelane ngalo nabampofu. Lapho uMntanenkosi Othokozile esecela umngani wakhe omusha ukuba ahlale amsize, iNkonjane ithola isifundo ngobubele nokunakekela abanye.\r\n\r\nInganekwane ka-Oscar Wilde engasoze yabuna exoxa ngobungani phakathi kukaMntanenkosi Othokozile neNkonjane, iphiliswa kabusha yimidwebo eyisimanga kaJoan Rankin. Le ndaba eselokhu yathandeka kusukela ekushicilelweni kwayo ngowe-1888 izothokozelwa ngokufanayo ngabadala nezingane.
Subtitle: null
Title: UMntanenkosi Othokozil
Author: Carole Bloch; Margaret Sixel

Description: Phezu kwesiqobo sawo eside esivelele isixeko, umfanekiso oqingqiweyo ogolide weNkosana eyOnwabileyo ubona ububi nenkxwaleko yabantu esixekweni esingezantsi kwawo. Ubongoza iNkonjane encinane ukuba isuse bonke ubucwebecwebe obukuyo ize yabelane ngabo nabantu abangamahlwempu. Ngelixa iNkosana eyOnwabileyo icela umhlobo wayo omtsha ukuba ahlale ze ayincede, iNkonjane ifunda isifundo ngokubonisa uvelwano nokukhathalela abanye.\r\n\r\nIbali elingaphelelwayo, elisenentsingiselo nanamhla oku nelibonisa uvelwano nenkathalo phakathi kweNkosana eyOnwabileyo neNkonjane lenziwe ukuba linike umdla ngakumbi yimizobo emangalisayo ezotywe ngenkathalo nguJoan Rankin. Ibali elisathandwa nanamhla oku elapapashwa okokuqala ngowe-1888, liza konwatyelwa ngabadala kunye nabantwana.
Subtitle: null
Title: Inkosana eyOnwabileyo
Author: Carole Bloch; Margaret Sixel

Description: Hodimo setulong sa hae se phahameng, Kgosana ya Thabileng, seemahale se setle sa kgauta, o kgona ho bona mahlomola a toropo ya hae tlase. O qeka Lefokotsanyana ho tlosa leruo la hae hore a le arolelane le bafutsana. Ha Kgosana ya Thabileng a kopa motswalle wa hae e motjha ho mo thusa, Lefokotsane le fumana thuto ya ho ba Mohau le ho tsotella.\r\n\r\nPale ya Oscar Wilde ya setswalle se sa teneng, se tletseng mohau pakeng tsa Kgosana ya Thabileng le Lefokotsane e tsoseletswa bophelo ke maikutlo le botaki bo hohelang ba Joan Rankin. Mmamoratwa ho tloha ha e ne e phatlalatswa lekgetlo la pele ka 1888, pale ena e hohelang e tla ratwa ke batswadi hammoho le bana.
Subtitle: null
Title: Kgosana ya Thabileng
Author: Carole Bloch; Margaret Sixel

Description: Die manjifieke goue standbeeld van die Gelukkige Prins kan van sy voetstuk die swaarkry onder in die stad sien. Hy pleit by ‘n Swaeltjie om al die kosbaarhede van hom af te pik en onder die arm mense uit te deel. As die Gelukkige Prins sy nuwe vriend vra om te help, leer die Swaeltjie hoe om goed te doen en om te gee.\r\n\r\nOscar Wilde se tydlose verhaal oor goedhartigheid in die vriendskap tussen die Gelukkige Prins en die Swaeltjie word lewendig uitgebeeld in die sensitiewe magiese kuns van Joan Rankin. Die betowerende verhaal, geliefd sedert dit die eerste maal in 1888 gepubliseer is, spreek tot oud en jonk.
Subtitle: null
Title: Die Gelukkige Prins
Author: Carole Bloch; Margaret Sixel

Description:
Malusi is a herd boy who tends to his grandfather’s sheep and goats among the mountains of the Transkei. High above, eagles fly while on the ground below, beetles crawl, termites scurry and dust flies as Malusi plays games of stick-fighting with his friend. But there’s danger too…

Can Malusi save his lambs from the hungry baboon who’s stalking the flock?

And who is the old man in the shiny car who stops to chat, and encourages the herd boy in his dream of being President?

This beautiful picture book is about a boy who dares to dream of a big future. It is a story of empowerment, self-belief and leadership, and is inspired by the life of former president Nelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: The Herd Boy
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Malusi ngumfana lowelusa timvu netimbuti tababe wakhe le etintsabeni taseTranskei. Nakelusile Malusi udlala tindvuku nebangane bakhe, kube ngetulu kwabo kundiza  emangce, laphansi kunyakatela tintfutfwane, emagenga kanye nemabhungane. Kodvwa-ke kunalenkhulu ingoti. Ingabe Malusi utawukhona yini kuvikela timvu tababe wakhe kunansi imfene letigegelako? Ingabe kona ngubani lobabe lohamba ngalemanyatelako imoto, lococisana naye ngemaphuphu ekutsi ngalelinye kungenteka aba nguMengameli welive? Lencwajana yetitfombe, ilandzisa ngemfanyana loneliphuphu ngelikusasa lakhe. Yindzaba lecoca kabanti ngekubanemandla, kutetsemba nebuholi, lesuselwa kumphilo yalowake waba nguMengameli waleli, Nelson  Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Umfana weKwelusa
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Malusi ke mošemane wa modiša yo a dišago dinku le dipudi tša rakgolo wa gagwe ka gare ga dithaba tša Transkei. Godimodimo, dintšu di a fofa mola e le gore fase mobung, dikhunkhwane di a gogoba, makeke a sepela ka lebelo gomme lerole le a fofa ka ge Malusi a raloka dipapadi tša go lwa ka dipatla le mogwera wa gagwe. Eupša gape go na le kotsi… Naa Malusi o tla phološa dinku tša gagwe go tšhwene ye e swerwego ke tlala ye e jago diruiwa? Naa bjale ke mang monna yo a tšofetšego yo a lego ka gare ga sefatanaga sa go phadima yo a emišago sefatanaga go boledišana le yena, ebile a hlohleletša mošemane yo monnyane ka torong ya gagwe ya go ba Mopresidente? Puku ye e botse ya diswantšho e bolela ka ga mošemane yo a nago le toro ya go ba le bokamoso bja go kgahliša. Ke kanegelo ya maatlafatšo, ya boitshepho le boetapele, gomme e hlohleleditšwe ke bophelo bja Mopresidente wa peleng Nelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mošemane wa Modiša
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Malusi ke modisa yo o tlhokomelang dinku le dipodi  tsa rraagwemogolo mo dithabeng tsa Transkei. Manong a fofa kwa godimo fa ditshenekegi tsona di gagaba mo fatshe, ditshoswane di a tlatlarietsa le lerole le a kupa jaaka Malusi a tshameka ntwa ya dithobane le tsala ya gagwe. Fela go na le kotsi gape… A Malusi a ka pholosa dikwana tsa gagwe go tswa go tshwene e e tshwerweng ke tlala e e setseng diruiwa morago? Gona monnamogolo yo o mo teng ga koloi e e phatsimang ke mang o o emang go tsaya dikgang le go rotloetsa modisa go tsweletsa toro ya gagwe ya go nna moporesidente pele?\r\n\r\nBuka e ntle eno ya ditshwantsho e ka ga mosimane yo o neng a lora ka bokamoso jo bo phatsimang. Ke kgang ya ga matlafatso, boitshepo le boetapele mme e tlhotlheleditswe ke botshelo jwa moporesidente Nelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Modisa
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Malusi ke modisana ya alosang dinku le dipodi tsa ntataemoholo dithabeng tsa Transkei. Hodimodimo dintsu di ntse di fofa ha tlase mobung kgolabolokwe di ntse di kgasa, dikokonyana di ya hodimo le tlase mme ho tletse lerole ha Malusi a ntse a bapala dipapadi tsa ho kalla ka melamu le motswalle wa hae. Empa ho kotsi le teng moo… Na Malusi a ka pholosa dikonyana tsa hae mehlaleng ya tshwene e lapileng e ntseng e di setse morao? Hape monna enwa ya koloing e majabajaba, ya emisang koloi ho bua le ho kgothalletsa modisana ho tswelapele ka toro ya hae ya ho ba mopresidente, ke mang? Buka ena e ntle ya ditshwantsho e bua ka moshemane ya neng a na le ditoro tsa bokamoso bo boholo. Ke pale ya boimatlafatso, ya boitshepo le boetapele, mme e fumane thahasello ho tswa bophelong ba mopresidente wa mehleng, e leng Nelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Modisana
Author: Niki Daly

Description:
UMalusi ngumfana owelusa izimvu nezimbuzi zikayisemkhulu ezintabeni zaseTranskei. Le phezulu kundiza izinkozi kanti phansi emhlabeni kuhuquzela amabhungane, kuphithizele umuhlwa, kushunqe izintuli ngenkathi uMalusi edlala imidlalo yokungcweka ngezinduku nomngani wakhe. Kodwa ikhona njalo nengozi… Ngabe uMalusi uzophumelela ukusindisa amazinyane kule mfene elambile ecathamela umhlambi?

Ngabe ngubani leli khehla elisemotini ecwebezelayo elimayo lixoxe, likhuthaze umalusi kuleli phupho analo lokuba nguMongameli?

Le ncwadi yezithombe ixoxa ngomfanyana ophupha ngekusasa eliqhakazile. Yindaba yokugunyaza nokuhlomisa umuntu, ukumnika ukuzethemba namandla obuholi. Okunguyena ongumthombo wogqozi lokubhalwa kwale ndaba ngowayengumongameli, uNelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: UMalusi
Author: Niki Daly

Description:
Malusi is ’n veewagtertjie wat sy oupa se skape en bokke in die berge van die Transkei oppas. Arende vlieg hoog in die lug, en onder op die grond kruip miskruiers rond, loop termiete in lang rye en hou Malusi stok-gevegte met sy maat. Maar daar is ook gevaar ... Kan Malusi sy lammers red van die honger bobbejaan wat hulle bekruip?

En wie is die ou man in die blink motor wat stilhou om met die seuns te gesels, en die skaapwagtertjie aanmoedig om te bly droom oor sy toekoms?

Hierdie pragtige prenteboek vertel van ’n seun wat groot drome droom. Dit is ’n verhaal van bemagtiging, geloof in jouself en leierskap, en is geïnspireer deur die lewe van oudpresident Nelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Die Veewagtertjie
Author: Niki Daly

Description:
Arm yourself with a pair of binoculars, compass and water canteen; get ready to step into a land of adventure where wild animals roam free; sit down with royalty, get lost in the vastness (that is the beautiful Land of Kachoo); and face the ultimate king of the savannah! 

The wondrous Land of Kachoo is ready for adventure, guaranteed to be a place revisited often, while read by the young explorers of Kachoo, our children! 

Author Tina Scotford and illustrator Frans Groenewald delight with this series of idly comical stories set in the fictional Land of Kachoo. The rhyming verse and quirky illustrations invite the reader to linger in the Land of Kachoo along with the lovable characters. These enchanting books will charm the child in everyone.
Subtitle: null
Title: Who is King in the Land of Kachoo?
Author: Tina Scotford

Description: This Baby and Busy Baby herald the dawning of a new phase in children’s literature in South Africa – they are the first board books in English, Afrikaans, Zulu and Xhosa to be developed in South Africa for 0 – 2 year olds. These delightfully illustrated fun-to-read texts developed by South Africa’s leading early literacy expert are sure to find their way onto the bookshelves of all our babies.\r\n\r\nAlso available in Afrikaans, Xhosa and Zulu
Subtitle: null
Title: Busy Baby
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: This Baby heralds the dawning of a new phase in children’s literature in South Africa – a first in board books in English, Afrikaans, Zulu and Xhosa, especially created in South Africa for 0 – 2 years olds. This delightfully illustrated fun-to-read text developed by South Africa’s leading early literacy expert is sure to find its way onto the bookshelves of all our babies.
Subtitle: null
Title: This Baby
Author: Carole Bloch

Description:
Author and illustrator Liz Mills presents her second collection of over 50 nursery rhymes and verse from popular children’s songs, specially reworked and adapted to appeal to children living in Africa. 

This delightful book follows on the overwhelming and continuing popularity of African Nursery Rhymes, which has been reprinted almost every year since it appeared in 2006. Nursery Rhymes & Verse from Africa is a must for a young child’s bookshelf as nursery rhymes form an essential part of children’s development, teaching them rhythm and rhyme and word skills, as well as improving memory. 

Liz’s colourful and often humorous illustrations and word imagery will capture the imagination and make reading an activity that children (and parents/carers) look forward to, whether at bed time, or any other time of the day. They will also want to return to these rhymes, with images that they can relate to, over and over again.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nursery Rhymes & Verse from Africa
Author: Liz Mills

Description: This bright, square picture book is a quality example of multilingual publishing for children. It contains seven nursery rhymes of Africa, each in a different South African language, followed by a catchy English translation. They are about frog, pig, chicken and a “mischievous bird,” butterfly, hare, spider, and ostrich. The double-spread pictures provide an accurate portrayal of character and situation. The verses (in rhythmic nursery rhyme style) are ideal for sharing aloud, and there is a guide to pronunciation at the end.
Subtitle: A Multilingual Collection of Rhymes from South Africa
Title: Diphoofolo
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker

Description: AMAYIPHENDLEYA – IsiQalo Sakho Konke tells the story of how four South African teenagers, Kwethu, Jo, Scott and Bobo, began their adventures of discovery in the world of what lies behind the technological wonders of the world today. Physics, mathematics, philosophy, history, culture, and life are just a few aspects of knowledge and its practice that the four encounter along their journey.
Subtitle: IsiQalo Sakho Konke
Title: AmaYiphendleya
Author: Phiwayinkosi G Mbuyazi

Description:
It’s a hot day on Zanzibar Road and Mama Jumbo puts on her jazzy dress 
and her ‘Flippy-floppy, flappy-slippy, this-way-that-way pom-pom hat’, hops 
in Mr Motiki’s taxi and heads off to the market.
After a long day of shopping, as Mama Jumbo heads home, Mr Motiki’s 
taxi has a puncture! How will Mama Jumbo save the day and get home to 
Little Chico?
Later, Mama Jumbo sews Little Chico a cute, tutti-frutti shirt from a piece 
of fabric that she got at the market. Little Chico is delighted with everyone’s 
reactions until Baba Jive says that he looks good enough to eat.
The quirky and much-loved gang from Zanzibar Road is back for another 
fun-filled adventure with Mama Jumbo, Little Chico and a host of colourful 
and entertaining characters that will delight children and adults alike
Subtitle: null
Title: Next Stop - Zanzibar Road
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Lele is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Lele on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: Milorho ya Lele
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lele is very busy today. He makes his way through his house asking each family member, “What are you doing?” Finally, it is dinnertime and Lele is nowhere to be found. Join Lele as he learns about reading and writing and why both are important everyday skills.
Subtitle: null
Title: U endla yini?
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: The rules to crossing the road are taught to children from a young age. Yimani, langutani mi tlhela mi yingisela! uses well-known African animals, including monkeys, zebras and giraffes, to teach children the rules of the road, showing them how important it is to obey them.
Subtitle: null
Title: Yimani, langutani mi tlhela mi yingisela!
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe; Carole Bloch

Description: The world is full of shapes. Everywhere you look you see circles, triangles and squares. This is a beautifully illustrated book that provides children with a wonderful and fun way to learn about shapes from the world around us.
Subtitle: null
Title: Swivumbeko swi hinkwako
Author: Carole Bloch

Description:
Ku hava xo tsakisa ku tlula buku ya switori leyi yi nandzihaka!

Buku ya switori i mudyondzisi, yi nga ku nyika miehleketo yi tlhela yi ku nyika mahungu.

Tibuku i vanghana highlights through rich text the amazing and FUN world of reading and books, from reading in the bath, to taking care of books and sharing ideas.
Subtitle: null
Title: Tibuku i vanghana
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: This is the story of how quick-thinking Zebra tricks the hungry Hyena into not eating him for dinner, with very prickly results. A delightful tale with striking paper collage illustrations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mangwa ya nhova ni Mhisi
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description:
Lexi i xitori xa vunharhu hi rhole ra Xinguni Pandzeka N’wa Xinguni Masasekana vito ra rona ku nga Pandzeka.

Sweswi, Pandzeka ni mzala wa yena Nyawa va lava ku byala mavele ni tinyawa va ya nghenela Nkombiso wa Varimisi. Xana va ta swi kota ku hlula hi ku humesa ntshovelo wo hlula hinkwayo kee?

Vito ra Pandzeka ra ntiyiso i ‘Ku pandzeka exikarhi ka marhavi ya mirhi’. Leswi swi endliwa hikuva a komba wonge u tshame endzhutini wa murhi, ni dyambu ri ri karhi ri endla mindzhuti edzobyeni ra yena. Vito ra Nyawa rona ri tirhisiwa hikuva dzovo ra yena ri ronge kova tinyawa hinkwako-kwako.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mavele ni Tinyawa
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Mi nga kholwa leswaku ku ni purasi exikarhi ka doroba ra Kapa? Mapilipili, masekwa, tinguluve, tinyimpfu ni tihomu leti tshamaka epurasini ra André, ekusuhi swinene ni le xivindzini xa doroba.\r\n\r\nHlaya hi ka Lynne ni mbyana ya yena, Famous, ni siku leri va nga byisa tihomu ta André leti a ti lahlekile ti muka ekaya.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ku Byisa tihomu ti muka ekaya
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: Lexi i xitori xa vumbirhi hi xirihodyana xa xingoni Pandzeka MASESEKANA. Xivulavula hi buruku ro LEHA leri a nga ri nyikiwa. Vito ra yena ra ntiyiso loko ri helerile i 'Makholo-kholo yo vangiwa hi ku pandzeka exikarhi ka marhavi ya mirhi'. Leswi swi vuriwa hikuva a tikomba wonge u lo tshama endzhutini wa murhi kutani ndzhuti wu tsala-tsala makholo-kholo yonge i ku pandzeka lomu xikarhi ka marhavi ya mirhi.
Subtitle: null
Title: Buruku yo Leha
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Nthyeketo lowu mi nga ta wu hlaya wu runguleriwe mutsari hi muheleketi wa vaendzi endzeni ka thekisi ya le tikweni ra swihlale ra Comores. Nthyeketo lowu wu runguriwa hinkwako laha Africa, wu pela wu ya eNigeria, eComores ni le Africa Dzonga. I nthyeketo wa Africa ni vaakatiko va yena.
Subtitle: null
Title: Vanghana vanharhu ni thekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Kulani a ku ri Xinhwanyetana lexi a xi rhandza tata wa xona hi mbilu ya xona hinkwayo. Kutani siku rin’wana tata Kulani yena a famba a nga ha vuyi. Kulani a twa kuvava ku fikela loko a tibyela leswaku yena a nga lavi ku kula. Kutani a tshama a ri ntsongo a nga kuli, hambiloko vanghana va yena va n’wi sapatela. Sikurin’wana mana wa yena a sungula ku vabya hikwalaho ka sweswo Kulani a ncinca miehleketo. A kula leswaku a ta kota ku pfuna ndyangu wa ka vona. Kambe loko khombo ri hlasela ximutana xa le ka vona, xana u kule ni ku tiyela kuringana ku va a nga ponisa vaakindhawu va le ka vona xana?
Subtitle: null
Title: Xinhwanyetana lexi a xi ala ku kula
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: Ntshwukeleni N’wa Ximbhahana u twa ndlalanyana kutani a ehleketa ku va a baka xinkwa. Kutani a endla nongonoko wa leswi swi nga ta laveka a nga si suka a ya nghena emasaneni ya mpundzu wa siku. U kombela vanghana va yena ku va va n’wi pfuna kambe va ala hinkwavo! Wonge u ta fanela ku tiendlela hinkwaswo?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ntshwukeleni N'wa Ximbhahana
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Mbuya Mabihana N’wa Xipilipilana a nga fani na wona mapilipili lama man’wana. Ndyangu wa rikwavo wa mapilipili wu tshamela ku n’wi vungunya leswi swi endla a titwa wonge a nga laviwi kasi wo lava ku rhandziwa ni ku titwa a ri un’wana wa vona. Hikwalaho wa baleka a sungula riendzo ro leha ra xivundza. Xana u ta pfuka a amukeriwile ni ku rhandziwa a ri leswi a nga xiswona xana?
Subtitle: null
Title: Mabihana N'wa Xipilipilana
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: Swiphongo swinharhu swa ka Mona a swi twa ndlala naswona swi karhele hi ku hanya hi ku khuxulela swijanana swa mitwa enhoveni ya ritshuri. Kasi kwala ntsungeni wa buloho a ku ri ni xintshabyana lexi nga tala hi byanyi bya rihlaza byo tsokombela lebyi swiphongo a swi tshamela ku byi navela. Kambe a swi chava  dzimamuhulu, xinghunghumana lexi a xi tshama ehansi ka buloho. Siku rin’wana timbuti leti tinharhu ta ka Mona ti twa ndlala ti tsandzeka ni ku tikhoma. Kutani ti endla kungu, ti tiya swivindzi ti pela buloho.  Xana ti ta swi kota ku hlula xinghunghumana kumbe xi ta ti khoma xi ti mita-mita kee?
Subtitle: null
Title: Swiphongo swinharhu swa ka Mona
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Buku leyi yo tala hi swifaniso yi rungula hilaha Muhluri a nga endla khayiti ni tata wa yena. Loko a ri karhi a yi hahisa, tintambhu ta yona ta tsemeka kutani yi chupuka yi sungula riendzo ro hlamarisa ra vurhena ro tsemakanya Afrika. Kusukela eka maboboma ya huwa ya Victoria ku ya fikela ehenhla ka tintshava ta gamboko eKilimanjaro, yi tsemakanya mananga ya Sahara ni leka tiphiramidi ta khale wa malembe ta Egipta, a hi landzeleleni khayiti loko yi ri karhi ku hundza hi le ka swivandla leswi swi nga tamela swihlamariso swa laha Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Riendzo ro haha ra khayiti
Author: William Gumede

Description: Xirhodyana xa Xinguni xi tele ku viliela. 'Wo nge a ndzi sasekanga ku ringana,' xi byela Mhani N'wa Xinguni wa Thokazi.
Subtitle: null
Title: N'wa Xinguni Masasekane
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: A delightful new series by Jenny Hatton exquisitely brought to life by award-winning illustrator, Joan Rankin.\r\n\r\nChildren will easily relate to the stories which reflect true to life events such as going on a journey, moving house and a visit to the beach. The rhythmic text of the Lucy books will help build children’s reading skills and confidence while they are absorbed in the humorous illustrations and the lives of Lucy’s family.
Subtitle: null
Title: Finding Aunt Joan
Author: Jenny Hatton

Description: Lele is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Lele on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: Lele o a lora
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Dangos wakes up on Monday morning with a dreadful sneeze. Her Aunty wants to take special care of her and so Dangos misses out on climbing trees, making dolls, playing with her friends and fishing with her uncle. Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?
Subtitle: null
Title: M-m nyaa!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lele is very busy today. He makes his way through his house asking each family member, “What are you doing?” Finally, it is dinnertime and Lele is nowhere to be found. Join Lele as he learns about reading and writing and why both are important everyday skills.
Subtitle: null
Title: O dirang?
Author: Carole Bloch

Subtitle: null
Title: Go thuma mo letsatsing
Author: Jenny Hatton

Title: Ema, leba mme o reetse!
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: The world is full of shapes. Everywhere you look you see circles, triangles and squares. This is a beautifully illustrated book that provides children with a wonderful and fun way to learn about shapes from the world around us.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dipopego di gotlhe
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: ’n Huis vir Tippie is ’n pragtige, atmosferiese verhaal oor die vriendskap tussen ’n seuntjie en ’n straatkat. Die seuntjie bring elke dag ’n nuwe bakkie melk en wen só die kat Tippie se vertroue. Maar op ’n dag is daar nie ’n bakkie nie. Geen bakkie nie,
Subtitle: null
Title: 'n Huis vir Tippie
Author: Tom Percival

Description: Die boomheks Arboreta het net een wens: dat kinders vir altyd en altyd veilig en gelukkig in haar woud moet rondspeel. Maar wie sal eendag die boomheks van die groot groen woud wees wanneer sy nie meer daar is nie? En wat sal gebeur as die houtkappers aan
Subtitle: null
Title: Arboreta,die heks met die groen hare
Author: Riana Scheepers

Description: Anna het ’n lewendige verbeelding met drome wat vir haar werklik voel. Een oggend word sy wakker en besef dat sy haar droom nie kan onthou nie. Saam met haar hond reis sy deur haar drome op soek na die verlore droom – 'n reis waarop hulle onder meer reuse
Subtitle: null
Title: Anna se verlore droom
Author: Thomas Docherty

Description: An African folktale with more than a touch of humour. Illustrations in warm colours. Graded as \"outstanding\" by the Horn Book.
Subtitle: null
Title: Loeto Lwa Kwa Tondo
Author: Verna Aardema, Will Hillenbrand

Description: An excellent addition to the folktales of Africa.\" - The Horn Book. In the beginning the sky was so close to the earth that the people could break a piece off by hand. It tasted good. But man became so greedy that the sky moved away.
Subtitle: null
Title: Goreng Lefaufau Le Le Kgakala Ga Kana
Author: Mary Joan Gerson, Carla Golembe

Description: The old legend of a ghost ship in the waters of the Cape of Storms. Told in text and illustrations full of drama, atmosphere and mystery.
Subtitle: null
Title: Pale Ya the Flying Dutchman
Author: Kathleen Milne; Brigitte Schröder; Sidima Mntubu

Description: A folk tale from Italy.
Subtitle: null
Title: Setlhare se se buang
Author: Sidima Mntubu; Inna Rayevsky

Description: A folktale from West Africa. Horn Book Guide (1994):- The illustrations contain a pleasing combination of greens, earth tones and bright patterns.
Subtitle: null
Title: Chinye
Author: Obi Onyefulu, Evie Safarewicz

Description: The king commands a blacksmith to make a living man out of iron or he would lose his life. But a friend knows how to solve the dilemma.
Subtitle: null
Title: Bothata ba mobetli wa ditshipi
Author: Kathleen Arnott; Annette Busse; Sidima Mntubu

Description: Ox Star's mistake when delivering a message from heaven brings good fortune and more meals to the people, though the ox must now provide the food.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ka moo naledi ya pholo e neng ya wa go tswa legodimong
Author: Lily Toy Hong; Sidima Mntubu

Description:
Dibuka ke Ditsala highlights through rich text the amazing and FUN world of reading and books, from reading in the bath, to taking care of books and sharing ideas.

Ga go sepe se se gaisang buka e ntle ya kgang!

Kgang ya buka ke morutabana, e abelana dikgopolo mme e go neela tshedimosetso.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dibuka ke Ditsala
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: As Mama watches from afar, Asanda visits the animals in her world, looking for a new friend. In this gorgeously illustrated book, the story introduces young children, between 2 and 7, to many animals, from Mischievous Cat to Crazy Crocodile, at the same time promoting a love for reading. Which animal will Asanda choose to be her friend? Children can also interact with the book by hunting for the ants on every page.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmakagiso o Batla Tsala
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: A o kile wa ipotsa gore goreng dintša di tshaba dikgwanyape? A o ipotsa gore goreng matlho a tsona a tlhagafala le gore goreng di roromela e bile di iphitlha? Batlisisa gore dikgomo tse di bosilo di tsieditse Ntša jang ka go di letla go tswa mo sakeng.
Subtitle: null
Title: Goreng Ntša e Tshaba Dipula tsa Matlakadibe
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description:
Sanele o tshaba lefifi.
O utlwa medumo e e sa
tlwaelegang mme ga a
kgone go tshwara boroko.
O dumela fa go na le
bodingwe ka fa tlase ga
bolao ba gagwe le tau
mo ntlong. Tota ke eng se
se tla thusang Sanele go
tshwara boroko?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ke mang yo o Tshabang Lefifi?
Author: Dianne Stewart

Description: Mofenyi wa Moputso wa Nobel Desmond Tutu o fitlhelela bana felo gongwe le gongwe ka molaetsa wa gagwe o o tletseng thotloetso wa lerato le boitshwarelano, ka mafoko a a borutho a a bonolo.\r\n\r\n“Ngwana o montle wa Modimo, O lora ka ga eng mo lefatsheng la gago la ditoro tse di monate go gaisa? A o lora ka go fofela godimo kwa loaping kgotsa kwa motsheng wa badimo go kgabaganya loapi?”
Subtitle: null
Title: Toro Ya Modimo
Author: Desmond Tutu; Douglas Carlton Abrams

Description: Koko Podi o kgalemela dipotsane tsa gagwe di le supa gore di se letlelele Phiri go tsena mo ntlong fa ena a seyo. Phiri wa leferefere o dira ka bojotlhe go raela bana gore ba mo letle go tsena mo ntlong? Ke mang yo o raelang yo mongwe kwa bofelong?
Subtitle: null
Title: Phiri le Dipotsane dile Supa
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Motshwaraditlhapi yo o humanegileng le morarraagwe Ba ne ba nna mo ntlwaneng ya bojang gaufi le lewatle. Ka letsatsi lengwe motshwaraditlhapi o ne a tshwara tlhapi e e gakagamatsang, mme ka ponyo ya leitlho a e golola. O ne a bolelela morwarragwe se se diragetseng mme ena o mo laela gore a ye go kopa tlhapi e e gakgamatsang ntlo e kgolwane. Tlhapi e e gakgamatsang ya neelana ka seo motshwaraditlhapi a neng a se eletsa. A morwarragwe o tla kgotsofala kgotsa o tla nna megagau mme a kopa sengwe gape?
Subtitle: null
Title: Tlhapi e e gakagamatsang
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Tsena mo leetong le Thando Rocker go ya motshamekong o mogolo wa kgwele ya maoto, nna mogaka wa ditoro tsa gago. Le wena fela jaaka Thando o ka kgona go fenya dipoifo tsa gago mme wa keteka katlego ya gago.
Subtitle: null
Title: Thando Rocker
Author: Dorothy Kowen

Description: Mosenyana Ayanda o ne a rata rraagwe ka pelo yotlhe ya gagwe. Letsatsi lengwe rraagwe o ne tsamaya mme a se tlhole a boa. Se se ne sa hutsafatsa Ayanda thata mme a tsaya tswetso ya gore ga a batle go gola. Ka jalo a nna mmotlana lobaka lo lo leele le fa ditsala tsa gagwe di ne di mo kgoba ka mafoko. Ka letsatsi lengwe mmaagwe o ne a lwala mme Ayanda a fetola mogopolo. O ne a gola gore a kgone go thusa balelapa la gagwe. Fela fa go ne go le mathata mo motseng wa gaabo, a tota o ne a tla kgona go thusa mongwe le mongwe?
Subtitle: null
Title: Mosetsanyana yo o neng a sa batle go gola
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: Kokwanyana e khibidu o ikutlwa a sa tshwerwe ke tlala e tshesane mme o swetsa go paka borotho. O dira lenaane la dilo tsotlhe tse a di tlhokang morago o wela tsela mo mosong o o mogote. O kopa ditsala tsa gagwe go mo thusa mme botlhe ba a gana. A o tla tshwanelwa ke go dira tsotlhe a le esi?
Subtitle: null
Title: Kokwanyana e Khibidu
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Pidipitshana ya Modimo e e maswe ga e tshwane le tse dipidipitshana tse dingwe. Lelapa la gaabo la dipidipidi le mo kgoba ka mafoko mme le dira gore a ikutlwe a sa batlege le fa tota ena a batla go ratiwa le go nna mong. O a sia mme o tsaya leeto le le leele le le bodutu. A tota o tla ratiwa le go amogelwa ka mokgwa o a leng ka teng.
Subtitle: null
Title: Pidipitshana e e Maswe
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: Diphoko tse tharo tsa Kerafu di tshwerwe ke tlala e bile di lapisitswe ke go nna mo sekgweng se se tletseng marole le mebitlwa. Go kgabaganya noka go thabana e e apesitsweng ke bojang jo bo monate jo bo tala boo di neng di eletsa go bo ja. Fela di ne di tshaba dimo yo o nnang fa tlase ga leborogo. A ba tla mo fenya kgotsa o tla ba tshwara mme a ba rwarwaetsa
Subtitle: null
Title: Diphoko Tse Tharo Tsa Kerafu
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Buka e e humileng ka ditshwantsho e, e tlotla setori ka ga moo Thato le rraagwe ba neng ba dira khaete ka eng. E rile ba re ba fofisa khaete, mogala wa yona wa kgaoga mme wa fofisetsa khaete kgakala go tsena mo leotong le le leele go ralala Aforika. Go tloga kwa Diphororong tse di thunyang tsa Victoria go ya kwa setlhoeng se se nang le semathana sa Kilimanjaro, go ya kwa dikakeng tsa Sahara le kwa Diphiramiting tsa Egypt. Sala khaete morago go ralala mafelo a e leng matshwao a magolo a lefatshe mo Aforika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Go Fofa ga Khaete
Author: William Gumede

Description: Thandi u lava tintanghu tintshwa naswona wa swi tiva leswaku ti ta durhela Kokwana wa yena. Kutani swin’we va ta na kungu ro kuma mali hi ku pfuniwa hi xipopana xa Nosipho na xinkukwana xa Pepi.
Subtitle: null
Title: Kece-kece exikhwameni xa mina
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Thandi o tlhoka ditlhako tse dišwa mme o a itse gore di ka jela Nkoko wa gagwe madi a mantsi. Ka jalo, mmogo ba loga leano la go bona madi ka thuso go tswa go Nosipho, mpopo wa gagwe le Pepi, mokoko wa gagwe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Tliki-tliki mo kgetsaneng ya me
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Thandi na mpopo wa yena Nosipho va lorha hi vutomi byo antswa, kambe emakumu va vona leswaku rirhandzu ra kokwa wa vona ri tlula hinkwaswo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ndzi nga va kwihi na kwihi
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Vatswari va Thandi va dlaye hi AIDS, naswona u fanele ku ya emahlweni a hanya na Kokwana wa yena. Switsudzuxo swa ndyangu wa yena swi rhungeleriwile eku endliweni ka xipopani xo hlawuleka – xipopana lexi nga endliwa hi, “swilapana swa magume”. Kambe I mani a kombaka Thandi leswaku a nga kuma njhani nseketelo na tshembho.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nosipho u te ku ta tshama na kokwana
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: Thandi le mpopo wa gagwe Nosipho ba lora ka botshelo jo bo botoka, fela kwa bofelong ba lemoga gore lorato lwa Nkoko wa ga Thandi lo gaisa dilo tsotlhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nka nna gongwe le gongwe
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Batsadi ba ga Thandi ba bolailwe ke AIDS, mme o tshwanetse go ya go nna le Nkoko wa gagwe. Dikgopolo tsa ba lelapa la gaabo di logeletswe mo go bopeng mpopi o o kgethegileng – mpopi o o dirilweng “thoto ya matsela a makgasa”, fela o bontsha Thandi gore a ka bona kgomotso le tsholofelo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nosipho o tla lapeng
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: Malusi ngumfana lowelusa timvu netimbuti tababe wakhe le etintsabeni taseTranskei. Nakelusile Malusi udlala tindvuku nebangane bakhe, kube ngetulu kwabo kundiza  emangce, laphansi kunyakatela tintfutfwane, emagenga kanye nemabhungane. Kodvwa-ke kunalenkhulu ingoti. Ingabe Malusi utawukhona yini kuvikela timvu tababe wakhe kunansi imfene letigegelako? Ingabe kona ngubani lobabe lohamba ngalemanyatelako imoto, lococisana naye ngemaphuphu ekutsi ngalelinye kungenteka aba nguMengameli welive? Lencwajana yetitfombe, ilandzisa ngemfanyana loneliphuphu ngelikusasa lakhe. Yindzaba lecoca kabanti ngekubanemandla, kutetsemba nebuholi, lesuselwa kumphilo yalowake waba nguMengameli waleli, Nelson  Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Umfana weKwelusa
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Dangos wakes up on Monday morning with a dreadful sneeze. Her Aunty wants to take special care of her and so Dangos misses out on climbing trees, making dolls, playing with her friends and fishing with her uncle. Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?
Subtitle: null
Title: Eyi Cha!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Zaza has a very busy and exciting day. From getting up, to singing and story time, it is always time for something fun! Join Zaza in her daily routine and find out all the interesting things she does.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ishayile!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lele is very busy today. He makes his way through his house asking each family member, “What are you doing?” Finally, it is dinnertime and Lele is nowhere to be found. Join Lele as he learns about reading and writing and why both are important everyday skills.
Subtitle: null
Title: Wentani?

Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Subtitle: null
Title: Takheko tikhona yonkhe indzawo
Author: Carole Bloch

Description:
Kute lokwehlula incwadzi yendzaba lemnandzi!

Incwadzi yetindzaba ingutishela, ikwabela imicondvo ikunikete nelwati.

Tincwadzi tibangani highlights through rich text the amazing and FUN world of reading and books, from reading in the bath, to taking care of books and sharing ideas.
Subtitle: null
Title: Tincwadzi tibangani
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Jabu is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Jabu on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: Jabu uyabhudza
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: As Mama watches from afar, Asanda visits the animals in her world, looking for a new friend. In this gorgeously illustrated book, the story introduces young children, between 2 and 7, to many animals, from Mischievous Cat to Crazy Crocodile, at the same time promoting a love for reading. Which animal will Asanda choose to be her friend? Children can also interact with the book by hunting for the ants on every page.
Subtitle: null
Title: Umngani wa Asanda
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lena yindzaba yesitsatfu lekhuluma ngelitfole leLISHAPHU lakaNguni lelinguKhala. Nyalo-ke, Khala banemzala wakhe Bhontjsi bafuna kulima ummbila nemabhontjisi balimele uMbukiso weBalimi. Batawuzuza nje umklomelo wesilimo lesishaya embili?\r\n\r\nPhela ligama laKhala mbamba ngu‘Khalatemitsi’. Loku kususelwa ekutsini kubukeka shengatsi uhleti emtfuntini wesihlala, lilanga lakha imidvwa yetitfunti esikhumbeni sakhe. Ligama laBhontjisi nguBhontjisi ngoba sakhe sikhumba sibukeka njengemabhontjisi lanemafatsafatsa.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ummbila neMabhontjisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Namanyana Nguni o ne a tshwenyega. ‘Ga ke mo dinakong sentlentle,’ a raya Kgomo Mma Nguni.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nguni yo o mo dinakong
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: E ke kgang ya bobedi mabapi le namane ya Nguni e e mo DINAKONG e e bidiwang Nafu. Ke kgang e e buang ka borukgwe jo BOLEELE jo a bo filweng. Leina la gagwe la nnete ke 'Nafu Gareng ga Dikala'. Se ke kantlha ya gore go lebega a kete o ntse mo moritung wa setlhare, mme letsatsi le dira moriti mo bomoragong jwa gagwe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Borukgwe jo Boleele
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: E ke kgang ya boraro ka ga namane ya Nguni e e mo dinakong e e bidiwang Diphatlha. Mo nakong e, Diphatlha le ntsalae Dinawa tsa Sukiri ba batla go jala mmopo le dinawa go bontshwa kwa dipontshong tsa Balemi. A ba tla fenya moputso wa sejalo se se gaisang?\r\n\r\nLeina la nnete la Diphatlha ke ‘Diphatlha fa Gare ga Dikala’. Se ke ka ntlha ya gore o lebega e kete o ntse mo moriting wa setlhare, mme letsatsi le dira diphatlha mo bomoragong jwa gagwe. Leina la nnete la Dinawa tsa Sukiri ke “Dinawa tse di Sukiri” ka ntlha ya gore bomorago jwa gagwe bo lebega e kete dinawa tse di sukiri tse di phatlotsweng.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmidi le Dinawa
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Lena yindzaba yesibili ngalelitfole leLIPHOPLILE lesiNgunilelibitwa ngaTikhala. Indzaba ikhuluma ngemabhuluko LAMADZE laphiwe wona. Ligama lakhe ngu 'Khalatemitsi'. Loku kwentiwa kutsi kubukeka shengatsi uhleti emtfuntini wesihlala, lilanga lona libe lenta imishi yetitfunti aceleni kwakhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Emabhuluko IaMadze
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Lenganekwane lotayifundza nyalo yacale yatekwa ngulosita tivakashi, ayiteka kumbhali basetekisini le etichingini teComores. Iyindzaba letekwa i-Afrika yonkhana, kusuka eNigeria kuye eComores kufike eNingizimu Afrika lombala. Iyindzaba ye-Afrika yonkhana nebantfu bayo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Bangani labatsatfu netekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Kgang e o tla e buisang e tlotletswe mokwadi la nthla ke mokaedi wa selegae mo thekising ya Comores. Ke kgang e e tlotliwang mo Aforika ka bophara, go tloga Nigeria go ya Comores le Aforika Borwa. Ke kgang e e leng ya MaAforika otlhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ditsala tse tharo le thekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Sidzandzanyana Ayanda utsandza uyise ngenhlitiyo yakhe yonkhe. Langa limbe ahambe uyise, nani kubuya. Weva buhlungu kakhulu Ayanda wate wancuma kutsi eme nsi angasakhuli yena. Kanjalo wahlala amncane sikhatsi lesidze, nebangani bakhe bate bahlekisa ngaye. Ngalelinye lilanga wagula kabi unina. Ayanda wagucula umcondvo. Wakhula waba mudze entela kusita umndeni wakhe. Kodvwa mhla kwehla inhlupheko esigodzini sakubo, ngabe uyoba mkhulu lokwenele yini kusindzisa wonkhe muntfu?
Subtitle: null
Title: Intfombatanyana lebeyingafuni kukhula
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: Nkhukhwana Bovana uva kungatsi ulambile, nango asukeka ancuma kubhaka sinkhwa. Wenta luhla lwalatakudzinga asuka lapho waphuma abhekana nelikuseni lelibalele bha. Ucela bagani bakhe kutsi basite kodvwa bonkhe bala! Utawukhona kwenta konkhe loku ayedvwa cwi?
Subtitle: null
Title: Nkhukhwana Bovana
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Nebakitsi! Dadana-Mbana ubukeka ehluke khashane kulamanye emadadana. Umndeni wakhe wakaDada uhlala umchukuluta njalo nje umenta ativele angatsandvwa, kantsi yena ufuna kutsandvwa nje abe yincenye yemndeni. Wasuka wabaleka ekhaya watsatsa luhambo loludze lwakhe yedvwa. Utsi uyoke atsandvwe futsi emukelwe njengoba anjalo?
Subtitle: null
Title: Dadana-Mbana
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: BoPhongo Ntsatfu Mahlikilili, balambe bayafa banjalo nje sebadziniwe kuhlala kulelihlandze lelinetintfuli nemanyeva. Ngale nje ngesheya kwelibhuloho kunentsatjana leyembonywe tjani lobumnandzi-nandzi lobuluhlata, bafisa kabi kubudla lobo tjani. Kodvwa, kunenkinga! Kunesilo lesesabekako lesihlala ngaphansi kwelibhuloho. Langa limbe, timbuti tatilambe kabi. Tancuma kutsi aticunge sibindzi tilewele lelibhuloho.Engabe titasibhacela silo ndzini noma sitatibamba sitishwabuludzele sitimite?
Subtitle: null
Title: BoPhongo Ntsatfu Mahlikilili
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lencwadzi lehlotjiswe kahle kakhulu iteka indzaba yekutsi Wandile baneyise bayakha njani ikhayithi. Basandizisa ikhayithi, lucu lwayo luyadzabuka kanjalo luyikhulule intjingeke etulu itsatse luhambokati lwekuncamula i-Afrika. Kusuka eTimphophomeni teVikithoriya letidvumako neticongo letinelichwa teKhilmanjaro, kufika etingwadvule teSahara nakumaPhiramidi eGibhithe asendvulo, indzaba ilandzela kundiza kwekhayithi ngetulu kwetindzawomlandvo letibabatekako telivekati le-Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Kundiza kweKhayithi
Author: William Gumede

Description: Tfole Nguni bekakhatsateke kabi. ‘Mine angisi shaphu kahle,’ akhala kuMake Nkhomati Nguni.
Subtitle: null
Title: BaNguni LabaShaphu
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: UMalusi welusa iigusha neebhokhwe ezintabeni zase Mpuma Koloni. Phezulu, apho kubhabha khona Ukhozi, lo gama phansi emhlabeni kuhamba iimbovane, oqongqothwane kunye neempukane kuqhume uthuli ebeth’iintonga nomhlobo wakhe. Kodwa kukwakho nezinto ezinobungozi… ingaba uMalusi uzawukwazi na ukukhusela amatakane akhe kwimfene ezichwechwela umhlambi wakhe? Kona ngubani le ngwevu ihamba ngomnyobo wemoto efika incokole nabo, ekwakhuthaza umelusi ukuba alandele iphupha lakhe lokuba nguMongameli?\r\n\r\nLe ncwadi enemizobo emihle kangakanana ithetha ngenkwenkwana enesibindi sokuba nephupha elikhulu. Eli libali elisipha amandla, ukuzethemba kunye nobunkokheli, ingempilo yowayesakuba nguMongameli utata uNelson Mandela.
Subtitle: null
Title: UMalusi
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Dangos wakes up on Monday morning with a dreadful sneeze. Her Aunty wants to take special care of her and so Dangos misses out on climbing trees, making dolls, playing with her friends and fishing with her uncle. Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?
Subtitle: null
Title: Hayi torho!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Zaza has a very busy and exciting day. From getting up, to singing and story time, it is always time for something fun! Join Zaza in her daily routine and find out all the interesting things she does.
Subtitle: null
Title: Lixesha
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lele is very busy today. He makes his way through his house asking each family member, “What are you doing?” Finally, it is dinnertime and Lele is nowhere to be found. Join Lele as he learns about reading and writing and why both are important everyday skills.
Subtitle: null
Title: Wenza ntoni?
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: A delightful new series by Jenny Hatton exquisitely brought to life by award-winning illustrator, Joan Rankin.\r\n\r\nChildren will easily relate to the stories which reflect true to life events such as going on a journey, moving house and a visit to the beach. The rhythmic text of the Lucy books will help build children’s reading skills and confidence while they are absorbed in the humorous illustrations and the lives of Lucy’s family.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukudada eLangeni
Author: Jenny Hatton

Description: As Mama watches from afar, Asanda visits the animals in her world, looking for a new friend. In this gorgeously illustrated book, the story introduces young children, between 2 and 7, to many animals, from Mischievous Cat to Crazy Crocodile, at the same time promoting a love for reading. Which animal will Asanda choose to be her friend? Children can also interact with the book by hunting for the ants on every page.
Subtitle: null
Title: Umhlobo ka-Asanda
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: A delightful new series by Jenny Hatton exquisitely brought to life by award-winning illustrator, Joan Rankin.\r\n\r\nChildren will easily relate to the stories which reflect true to life events such as going on a journey, moving house and a visit to the beach. The rhythmic text of the Lucy books will help build children’s reading skills and confidence while they are absorbed in the humorous illustrations and the lives of Lucy’s family.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukutshintsha indlu
Author: Jenny Hatton

The rhythmic text of the Lucy books will help build children’s reading skills and confidence while they are absorbed in the humorous illustrations and the lives of Lucy’s family.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukufumana uMakazi uJoan
Author: Jenny Hatton

Description: Using rhythmic text to help build children’s reading skills, combined with gorgeous illustrations, Into ongayenza tells the charming story of how sharing a book can brighten your day.\r\n\r\nFrom award-winning author, Ann Walton, who won the prestigious Katrine Harries Award and illustrated by Natalie Hinrichsen.
Subtitle: null
Title: Into ongayenza
Author: Ann Walton

Description:
Ayikho into edlula incwadi yebali elimnandi!

Incwadi yebali ingutitshala owabelana ngezimvo ekunika nolwazi.

Iincwadi zingabahlobo highlights through rich text the amazing and FUN world of reading and books, from reading in the bath, to taking care of books and sharing ideas.
Subtitle: null
Title: Iincwadi zingabahlobo
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: This is the story of how quick-thinking Zebra tricks the hungry Hyena into not eating him for dinner, with very prickly results. A delightful tale with striking paper collage illustrations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Iqwarhashe neNgcuka
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: This is the story of how quick-thinking Zebra tricks the hungry Hyena into not eating him for dinner, with very prickly results. A delightful tale with striking paper collage illustrations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Pitse ya naga le Phiri
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: Wakhe wazibuza ukuba kutheni izinja zisoyika iindudumo? Ingaba uyazibuza ukuba kutheni amehlo azo eba nobundlobongela, ukuba kutheni zingcangcazela futhi zizimele? Fumanisa ukuba iinkomo ezinentlondi zayiqhatha njani iNja ukuba izivulele ziphume ebuhlanti bazo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Kutheni iNja iSoyika iSiphango
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description:
USanele uyaboyika
ubumnyama. Uva
ingxolo eyoyikisayo atsho
angakwazi ukulala. Ucinga
ukuba kukho iigrogro
phantsi kwebhedi yakhe
nengonyama endlini.
Yintoni eya kunceda
uSanele alale ebusuku?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ngubani Owoyika ubuMnyama?
Author: Dianne Stewart

Description: UZithuba nomzala wakhe uMbotyi bafuna ukudlala umdlalo wesoka phambi kokutshona kwelanga! Bancedise bafumane ibhola yabo elahlekileyo, ifihlwe kwenye indawo kwiAfrika yethu emangalisayo.\r\n\r\nLe yincwadi yesine ebalisa ngenkonyana entle kaNguni negama layo linguZithuba. Igama lokwenene likaZithuba, ‘NguZithuba ziPhakati kwamaSebe’. Oku kwenziwa kukuba ubonakala ngokunga uhleli phantsi komthunzi womthi, kwaye ilanga lenza imithunzi esikhumbeni sakhe. UMbotyi yena igama lakhe ‘nguMbotyi’ kuba isikhumba sakhe sifana nqwa neseembotyi ezinamachokoza.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ibhola Elahlekileyo
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Le yincwadi yesithathu ngethole likaNguni OMHLE elithiywe ngokuba nguZithuba. Ngeli ityeli, uZithuba nomzala wakhe uMbotyi bafuna ukulima umbona neembotyi belimela Umboniso wamaFama. Ingaba bethu baza kuliphumelela ibhaso lesityalo esisesona singcono.\r\n\r\nIgama lokwenene likaZithuba, ‘NguZithuba ziPhakathi kwamaSebe’. Oku kwenziwa kukuba ubonakala ngokunga uhleli phantsi komthunzi womthi, kwaye ilanga lenza imithunzi esikhumbeni sakhe. UMbotyi yena igama lakhe ‘nguMbotyi’ kuba isikhumba sakhe sifana nqwa neseembotyi ezinamachokoza.
Subtitle: null
Title: UMbona noMbotyi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Ngamazwi anothando nalula, uDesmond Tutu owazuza iNobel Peace Prize udlulisa lo myalezo ochukumisayo wothando noxolo kubantwana kwiindawo zonke.\r\n\r\n\"Mntwana othandekayo kaThixo, Uphupha ngantoni kwawona maphupha akho akhe amnandi? Ingaba uphupha ngokubhabha uye phezulu okanye uphupha ngeminyama enqumla isibhakabhaka?”
Subtitle: null
Title: Iphupha Likathixo
Author: Desmond Tutu; Douglas Carlton Abrams

Description: Eli bali lichaza ukuba kungani iLanga likhanyisa emini ze iNyanga ikhanyise ebusuku. \r\n\r\n“Kudaladala iLanga lalihlala emhlabeni. Kodwa lalitshisa kangangokuba amahlathi neentyatyambo zazivutha xa lidlulayo. Imilambo yayibila ipheka iintlanzi namaxoxo neengwenya.”
Subtitle: null
Title: Intsomi yeLanga neNyanga
Author: Ann Walton

Description:
“Ndifuna ukuyozingela noTata kunye noKattau,” wamxelela oko unina.

“Hayi, siza kuhamba nabanye abafazi,” waphendula ngelo unina, ngelixa egone uNyama. “Simele siya kumba iingcambu size sikhe namaqunube.”

UNyama neMpofu libali lokukhula kukaNyama, intwazana ezalwa ngabaThwa. UNyama umamela uninakhulu embalisela amabali ayolisayo emveli athetha ngemvelaphi yezichotho, umoya nenyanga kwakunye nomntan’ ezulu nempofu. Izinto zimtshintshela uNyama xa ethonjiswa, nto leyo ithi imkhokelele kuhambo lokufunda okuninzi ngaye nangabantu bakowabo.

Eli bali limangalisayo nemifanekiso yalo eqaqambileyo liza kuba nomtsalane kwabancinane nakwabadala.
Subtitle: null
Title: UNyama neMpofu
Author: Dorothy Kowen

Description: ISipho seGolide sinazo zonke iimpawu zentsomi yodidi; isiqalekiso, ingqalutye yegolide yamathamsanga elahlekileyo, intombazana encinci ethanda ukwazi kananjalo, isiphelo esimnandi. Abalinganiswa ngabaseMzantsi Afrika; uhlanga oluthile oluthandazela imvula, ulovane oluthethayo, notokoloshe ongaqondwayo. Imizobo kaMathew imbeje-mbeje, iyothusa, ivusa umdla kodwa mihle. Kanti ibali likaKowen libhalwe lalula kwaye linomtsalane. Isifundo seso thina sonke sifanele ukusigcina; “Ungaze uthabathele kuwe isipho obusinike omnye umntu. Isipho ngumqondiso wothando. Ungaluthabathela kuew njani kwakhona uthando lwakho?”\r\n\r\nGlenda Neville, The Big Issue
Subtitle: null
Title: ISipho seGolide
Author: Dorothy Kowen

Description: UGogo Bhokhwe wawalumkisa amatakane akhe amancinci ebhokhwe asixhenxe ukuba angayivuleli iNgcuka ingene endlini xa engekho. Ingcuka enamaqhinga yazama kangangoko inako ukuqhatha amatakane ebhokhwe ukuba ayingenise endlini! Ingaba amatakane ebhokhwe asixhenxe aya kukhuseleka kwiNgcuka? Ngubani oqhatha omnye ekugqibeleni?
Subtitle: null
Title: INgcuka kunye namaTakane amaNcinci eBhokhwe asiXhenxe
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Umlobi olihlwempu nobhuti wakhe babehlala kwindlu yengca kufutshane nolwandle. Ngenye imini, umlobi wabamba intlanzi yobugqi ethethayo nathe ngokukhawuleza wayibuyisela elwandle. Uxelele ubhuti wakhe into eyenzekileyo waze ubhuti wakhe wamnyanzelisa ukuba ahambe acele kwintlanzi yobugqi indlu enkulu. Intlanzi yobugqi yamnika umnqweno wakhe. Ingaba ubhuti wakhe uya koneliseka okanye uya kunyoluka afune okunye okuninzi?
Subtitle: null
Title: INtlanzi yoBugqi
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Joyina uThando Rocker kuhambo lwakhe oluya kumdlalo omkhulu wesoka, nokuba nesibindi sokuba namaphupha uze ube ligorha elilelakho. NjengoThando, nawe ungaloyisa uloyiko lwakho uze ubhiyozele impumelelo yakho.
Subtitle: null
Title: UThando Rocker
Author: Dorothy Kowen

Description: Eli libali lesibini elingethole ELIHLE lesiNguni elibizwa ngokuba nguZithuba. Lingebhulukhwe ENDE ayinikiweyo. Elona gama lakhe lokwenene 'nguZithuba Phakathi kwamaSebe omthi'. Kungokuba kubonakala ngokungathi uhleli phantsi komthi, lize ilanga lenze imithunzi esikhumbeni sakhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ibhukhwe Ende
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Intombazanana encinci u-Ayanda imthanda ngokungathethekiyo utata wayo. Ngenye imini utata ka-Ayanda uyahamba, angaze abuye. U-Ayanda ukhathazeka kangangokuba ude agqibe ukubeni akasokuze akhule abe mdala. Uye ke wahlala emncinci, engakhuli ixesha elide, nakubeni abahlobo bakhe bemgezela. Ngenye imini umama wakhe uye wagula waze u-Ayanda watshintsha isigqibo sakhe sokungafuni ukukhula. Uyakhula ukuze akwazi ukuncedisa usapho lwakhe. Kodwa ingaba umdala okanye uligorha ngokwaneleyo na ukusombulula iingxaki ezivelela ilali yakhe?
Subtitle: null
Title: Intombazana encinane eyayingafuni ukukhula
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: ISikhukukazi esiBomvu esiNcinane siziva silambile, ze sigqibe ekubeni senze isonka. Sibhala uluhlu lwezinto esiza kuzidinga size sihambe ngentseni eshushu. Sicela abahlobo baso ukuba basincede kodwa bonke abavumi. Ngaba kufuneka senze lo msebenzi sodwa?
Subtitle: null
Title: Isikhukukazi esiBomvu esiNcinane
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Usizana olungudadana olubi, lukhangeleka lohlukile kwamanye amadada. Usapho lwakhe luhlekisa ngaye, lumenze azive engafunwa, nangona yena efuna ukuziva enosapho olumthandayo nolumamkelayo. Ngoko ke udadana ushiya ikhaya lakhe athathe uhambo olude eyedwa. Ingaba uya kuze athandwe yaye amkelwe ngendlela ayiyo?
Subtitle: null
Title: UDadana Ombi
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: OoBhokhwana abaThathu bakwaGruff balambile yaye badiniwe kukuhlala kwidlelo eliqhumayo nelinameva. Ngaphaya kwebhulorho kukho indulana egqunywe nguqaqaqa oluhlaza yaka nonencasa abarhalela ukumtya. Kodwa boyika irhamncwa  elihlala phantsi kwebhulorho. Ngenye imini balambe bathe nca phantsi kangangokuba bagqiba ekubeni bayiwele ibhulorho. Ingaba baza kukwazi ukuliqhatha irhancwa okanye liza kubanqakula libabimbilize?
Subtitle: null
Title: OoBhokhwana abaThathu bakwaGruff
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Le ncwadi enemiboniso emihle isibalisela ngendlela uSipho notata wakhe abenze ngayo ikayiti. Ngexa bebhabhisa ikayiti, umtya wayo uye waqhawuka, yaphuncuka ikayiti yatsho yaqalisa uhambo lwayo lodumo kwi-Afrika iyonke. Ukusuka kwiingxangxasi ezidudumayo iVictoria Falls nemintla eyogqunywe likhephu yeKilimanjaro, ukuya kwintlango yaseSahara neePhiramidi zakudala zaseYiphutha, landela ukubhabha kwekayiti phezu kwezona ndawo ezizimpawu ezibalulekileyo zase-Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukubhabha kweKayiti
Author: William Gumede

Description: UThandi udinga izihlangu ezintsha kwaye uyazi ukuba ziza kudla imali eninzi kamakhulu. Bekunye beza necebo lokufumana imali ngoncedo lukaNosiph, unodoli wakhe, noPepi umqhagi wakhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Khenkce-khenkce epokothweni yam
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: UThandi nonodoli wakhe uNosipho banamaphupha obomi obungcono, kodwa ekugqibeleni bayabona ukuba uthando lukamakhulu kaThandi ludlula konke.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ndingabakho naphina
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Abazali bakaThandi babulewe yi-AIDS, kwaye kufuneka ayokuhlala  noMakhulu wakhe. Iinkumbulo zosapho lwakhe zolukwe ngokwenza unodoli okhethekileyo – unodoli owenziweyo “ngeziqwenga ezimbalwa ezingafaniyo.” Kodwa obonisa uThandi indlela yokufumana intuthuzelo nethemba.
Subtitle: null
Title: UNosipho uzokuhlala oko
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: Le ntsomi uzakuyifunda umbhali wayo wayibaliselwa ngowayekhokela kwitekisi yeziqithi zeComores. Yenye yeentsomi ezibaliswa kulo lonke eli leAfrika, ukusuka eNigeria ukuya kuthi xha kwiiComores kuzokuthi ga eMzantsi Afrika.\r\n\r\nAbahlobo abathathu netekisi won the Sappi Isiqalo Book Competition, which encourages South African authors and illustrators to develop materials with a local idiom to promote reading, writing and access to books for all.
Subtitle: null
Title: Abahlobo abathathu netekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: \"Khangela phezulu. Khangela kulaa mihlambi kaNguni isesibhakabhakeni. Khangela ela dlelo idla kulo le mihlambi, likhanyiswe ngokuqaqambileyo. Yhu! Zaze zaninzi iinkomo zikaNguni. Zinto eziimpuphu zazo zinyathela kuvuleke umngxuma emazulwini, kutsho kuthi gqi iinkwenkwezi kuloo mingxuma yazo, zikhanyise isibhakabhaka.\"\r\n\r\nUNguni omhle is a richly illustrated story about a young Nguni calf who questions his identity in relation to other cattle breeds across the sea. The 15 hand-painted original illustrations and sensitive text draw upon Africa's love and respect for Nguni cattle, explaining the importance and myths surrounding cattle to a new generation.
Subtitle: null

Author: Maryanne Bester

Ba ahelwa letamo le phethahetseng la baahi, mme le rehellwa ka sehlopa sa bona. Ena ke thahasello ya batjha ntshetsong pele ya setjhaba.

Author: K.P.D. Maphalla

Description: Meqoqo e bukeng ena e leka ho totobatsa hore motho ka mong ke wa bohlokwa bophelong. Empa motho eo wa bohlokwa e ka ba kgalala ha feela a etsa seo a lokelang ho se etsa ka tshwanelo. Ke tseo! Buka ena e loketse batjha le batho ba baholo.\r\n\r\nEvery human being has a very important role to play in life. We can only remain upright and true if we do what is right.

Description: Bafana is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Bafana on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: UBafana uyabhudanga
Author: Carole Bloch

Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?

Author: Carole Bloch

Description: The rules to crossing the road are taught to children from a young age. Jama, qala bese uyalalela! uses well-known African animals, including monkeys, zebras and giraffes, to teach children the rules of the road, showing them how important it is to obey them.
Subtitle: null
Title: Jama, qala bese uyalalela!
Author: Geekie Dawe

Description: UZikhala nomzala wakhe uBhontshisi bafuna ukudlala umdlalo webhola lezinyawo lingakashoni ilanga. Basize bathole ibhola labo elilahlekile, elicashe kwelinye lamadlelo ase-Afrika.\r\n\r\nLena indaba yesine ngenkonyana leNguni Elihle elibizwa ngokuthi uZikhala. Igama likaZikhala langempela ‘nguZikhalazemithi.’ Phela ubukeka sengathi uhleli ngaphansi komthunzi wesihlahla, izithunzi zamagatsha ezenziwa yilanga zibonakala phezu kwesikhumba sakhe. UBhontshisi yena igama lakhe nguBhontshisi ngoba isikhumba sakhe sibukeka sengathi ubhontshisi omakhwifikhwifi abomvu namhlophe.

Title: Ibhola Elilahlekile
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Lena indaba yesithathu yenkonyane iNguni Elihle elaziwa ngokuthi uZikhala. Kule ndaba, uZikhala nomzala wakhe uBhontshisi bafuna ukutshala ummbila nobhontshisi khona bezongenela Umbukiso Wabalimi. Ngabe bazowuthola umklomelo wesivuno esiphuma phambili?\r\n\r\nIgama likaZikhala langempela ‘Eziphakathi Kwamagatsha Emithi’. Phela ubukeka sengathi uhleli ngaphansi komthunzi wesihlahla, izithunzi zamagatsha ezenziwa yilanga ziwela phezu kwesikhumba sakhe. Igama langempela ‘uZikhalazikhala Zemithi’ ngoba isikhumba sakhe sibukeka sengathi ubhontshisi omakhwifikhwifi abomvu namhlophe.

Ngabe uphupha undizela phezulu emafini noma ngothingo lwenkosazane olufinyelela phezulu esibhakabhakeni?”

Kodwa lalishisa kakhulu ngoba amahlathi nezimbali zazivele zishe ziphele uma iLanga lidlula ngakuzona. Imifula yayivele ibile izipheke zonke izinhlanzi, izingwenya namaxoxo.”

Title: Indaba yeLanga neNyanga

Description: Indaba ethi Isipho seGolide inayo yonke imininingwane yengwanekwane; itshe lenhlanhla legolide elilahlekile, intombazanyana ehlakaniphile kanye nesiphetho esijabulisayo. Abalingiswa ngama-Afrika; isizwe esithandazela imvula, umnwabu olukhulumayo kanye notokoloshe ongaqondisiswa ngabantu. Izithombe zikaMathew zinhle, zishayisa uvalo, zisusa usinga, ziyabukeka ngokunjalo. Indaba kaKowen ibhalwe kahle. Isifundo sale ndaba kufanele sonke sisilandela; “Akufanele uphuce umuntu isipho omuphe sona. Isipho indlela yokukhombisa uthando. Ungazephuca kanjani uthando Iwakho?\r\n\r\nNguGlenda Neville, we-The Big Issue
Subtitle: null
Title: Isipho seGolide
Author: Dorothy Kowen

Description: UGogo iMbuzi uyala amazinyane ayisikhombisa ukuthi angalokothi angenise iMpisi endlini uma engekho ekhaya. Impisi enamaqhinga izama ngawo wonke amandla ukukhohlisa amazinyane ukuthi ayingenise endlini! Ngabe amazinyane ayisikhombisa azosinda kule Mpisi? Ngubana ngempela ophica omunye ekugcineni?

Title: Impisi namaZinyane Embuzi Ayisikhombisa

Description: Umdobi ongenalutho uhlala nomfowabo endlini encane eyiqhugwane elakhiwe ngotshani ngasolwandle. Ngelinye ilanga, umdobi ubamba ufi shi onomlingo okhulumayo, kodwa uyawudedela ngokushesha. Uxoxela umfowabo ngalesi simanga sofi shi awubonile. Umfowabo uyamphoqa ukuthi ahambe ayocela ufi shi ukuthi ubenzela indlu enkulu.Ufi shi nempela uyasifeza isifi so sabo, ngokubenzela indlu enkulu. Ngabe umfowabo kuzomanelisa lokhu noma uzoba nomhobholo afune okunye?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ufishi Onomlingo

Title: Ibhulukwe Elide

Description: U-Ayanda uthanda ubaba wakhe ngenhliziyo yakhe yonke. Ngelinye ilanga ubaba wakhe uhamba sengathi uzobuya kodwa lutho uhamba unomphela. Lokhu kumzwisa ubuhlungu kakhulu uze uthatha isinqumo sokuthi akafuni ukukhula. Uhlala isikhathi eside eyingane encane, kwala ngisho noma abangane bakhe bemgcona. Ngelinye ilanga umama wakhe uyagula, lokhu kumenza ukuthi awushintshe umqondo wakhe. Uqala ukukhula uba mude ukuze akwazi ukusiza umndeni wakhe. Nakhu sekuvela umonakalo esigodini sangakubo! Ngabe u-Ayanda mkhulu ngokwanele kanti futhi ngabe unaso isibindi sokuvikela wonke umuntu wendawo?

Title: Intombazanyana eyayingafuni ukukhula

Title: USikhukhukazana obomvu

Ngakho ke liyabaleka ekhaya lithatha uhambo olude futhi olunesizungu. Ngabe liyoke liluthole uthando nokwamukelwa yize lingafani namanye amadada?

Title: Udado Omubi
