Description: Izimpongo ezintathu ezinyukubele zilambile futhi zikhathele ukuhlala ehlathini eligcwele ameva nothuli. Ngapheshaya kwebhuloho kuneqguma elimbozwe utshani obuluhlaza obunephunga elimnandi ezifisa sengathi zingabudla. Kodwa zisaba inunu enkulu esabakayo ehlala ngaphansi kwebhuloho. Ngelinye ilanga indlala yaziphatha zaze zazidela zahamba zayokweqa ibhuloho. Ngabe zizoyihlula le nunu noma inunu izozibamba izidle izishwabadele iziqeda nya?
Subtitle: null
Title: Izimpongo ezintathu ezinyukubele
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Le ncwadi enezithombe ezinhle isixoxela ngokuthi u-Andile nobaba wakhe balakha kanjani ikhayithi. Ngesikhathi bendizisa ikhayithi,\r\nintambo yalo iyanqamuka idedela ikhayithi elithatha uhambo olude lwe-Afrika. Ukusuka empophomeni iVictoria eduma njengezulu kuya ezicongweni ezembathiswe iqhwa zentaba iKilimanjaro, kuze kuyofika ogwadule iSahara nakumaPhiramidi amadala  aseGibhithe. Lilandele leli khayithi elindiza phezu kwezindawo zekhethelo zase-Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Ikhayithi Elindizayo
Author: William Gumede

Description: Abazali bakaThandi babulawe yi-AIDS, ngakho kufanele aye kohlala nogogo wakhe. Inkumbulo yomndeni wakhe ivezwa ngokulandela umcikilisho wokwenza unodoli oyisipesheli – unodoli owenziwe “ngezidwedwe ezimbalwa ezingacacile”, kepha okwazi ukubonisa uThandi induduzo nethemba.
Subtitle: null
Title: UNosipho uzohlala noGogo
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: UThandi nodoli wakhe uNosipho baphupha ngempilo emnandi, kodwa bagcina bebona ukuthi uthando lukagogo kaThandi lwedlula konke.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ngingaba noma kuphi
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: UThandi udinga izicathulo ezintsha kodwa uyazi ukuthi zizombiza imali enkulu ugogo wakhe. Ngakho ke, bobali benza icebo lokwenza imali ngokuthola usizo kuNosipho, udoli wakhe kanye noPepi, iqhude elingumngane wakhe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Kukhala imali ekhukhwini lami
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Lendaba ozoyifunda umbhali wayixoxelwa indoda yendawo esethekisini esiqhingini saseComores. Yindaba nje exoxwayo neyaziwayo kakhulu emazweni ase-Afrka, kusuka eNigeria kuya eComores kuze kufi ke eNingizimu Afrika. Yindaba yabantu bonke base-Afrika.\r\n\r\nAbangane abathathu nethekisi won the Sappi Isiqalo Book Competition, which encourages South African authors and illustrators to develop materials with a local idiom to promote reading, writing and access to books for all.
Subtitle: null
Title: Abangane abathathu nethekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: \"Bheka laphaya phezulu. Bheka umhlambi wezinkomo zezulu zesiNguni. Bheka lapho zidla khona utshani ekukhanyeni okumangalisayo. Izinkomo zesiNguni ziningi yini pho! Zishiya amacashaza ezinselo zawo emkhathini zikhanyise isibhakabhaka ngezinkanyezi.\"\r\n\r\nINguni Elihle is a richly illustrated story about a young Nguni calf who questions his identity in relation to other cattle breeds across the sea. The 15 hand-painted original illustrations and sensitive text draw upon Africa's love and respect for Nguni cattle, explaining the importance and myths surrounding cattle to a new generation.
Subtitle: null
Title: INguni Elihle
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Batswadi ba Thandi ba bolailwe ke AIDS, mme o tlamehile ho ya dula le Nkgono wa hae. O hopola tsa lelapa la habo ka ho etsa popo e ikgethang – popo e entsweng “ka dikgetjhana tse mmalwa tse sa tshwaneng”, empa e thusang ho tshedisa Thandi le ho mo fa tshepo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nosipho o tla lapeng
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: Thandi le popo ya hae, Nosipho, ba labalabela bophelo bo monate ho feta ka moo ba phelang ka teng, empa qetellong ba elellwa hore lerato la Nkgono wa Thandi le molemo ho feta tsohle.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nka ba kae kapa kae
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Thandi o hloka dieta tse ntjha mme o tseba ka botlalo hore ho hlokeha tjhelete e ngata. Tjhelete eo Nkgonwae sat lo e kgonang. Ka hoo, ba etsa leqheka la ho bokella tjhelete mmoho, ka thuso ya Nosipho le popo ya hae le Pepi, mokoko wa hae oo a o ratang.
Subtitle: null
Title: Tswiki-tswiki ka pokothong ya ka
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Lebohang is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Lebohang on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: Toro ya Lebohang
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Dangos wakes up on Monday morning with a dreadful sneeze. Her Aunty wants to take special care of her and so Dangos misses out on climbing trees, making dolls, playing with her friends and fishing with her uncle. Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?
Subtitle: null
Title: Atjhee!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Zaza has a very busy and exciting day. From getting up, to singing and story time, it is always time for something fun! Join Zaza in her daily routine and find out all the interesting things she does.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ke nako!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: A delightful new series by Jenny Hatton exquisitely brought to life by award-winning illustrator, Joan Rankin.\r\n\r\nChildren will easily relate to the stories which reflect true to life events such as going on a journey, moving house and a visit to the beach. The rhythmic text of the Lucy books will help build children’s reading skills and confidence while they are absorbed in the humorous illustrations and the lives of Lucy’s family.
Subtitle: null
Title: Lerato o sesa letsatsing le tjhesang
Author: Jenny Hatton

Description: The rules to crossing the road are taught to children from a young age. Ema, qamaka hape o mamele! uses well-known African animals, including monkeys, zebras and giraffes, to teach children the rules of the road, showing them how important it is to obey them.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ema, qamaka hape o mamele!
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: This is the story of how quick-thinking Zebra tricks the hungry Hyena into not eating him for dinner, with very prickly results. A delightful tale with striking paper collage illustrations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Qwaha le Lefiritshwane
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: As Mama watches from afar, Asanda visits the animals in her world, looking for a new friend. In this gorgeously illustrated book, the story introduces young children, between 2 and 7, to many animals, from Mischievous Cat to Crazy Crocodile, at the same time promoting a love for reading. Which animal will Asanda choose to be her friend? Children can also interact with the book by hunting for the ants on every page.
Subtitle: null
Title: Motswalle wa Asanda
Author: Carole Bloch

Description:
Setsoto o tshaba lefifi.
O utlwa medumo e sa
tlwaelehang mme a hlobaele.
O nahana hore ho na le
dikgokgo tse ipatileng ka
tlasa bethe ya hae, le hore ho
na le tau e keneng ka tlung.
Ke eng e tla thusang Setsoto
hore a kgalehe, bosiu?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ke mang ya tshabang lefifi?
Author: Dianne Stewart

Description:
Ena ke pale ya boraro ya namane E NTLE ya Bokone e bitswang Masedi.

Kgetlong lena Masedi le motswalae Nawa ba batla ho lema poone le dinawa bakeng sa Pontsho ya Balemi. Ebe ba tla hapa kgau bakeng sa tjhai e babatsehang ka ho fetisa?

Lebitso la hae ha le feletse ke ‘Masedi Pakeng tsa Makala’. O rehilwe lebitso lena hobane o shebeha e ka o dutse moriting wa sefate mme letsatsi le etsa matheba letlalong la hae. Athe Nawa yena o rehilwe lebitso lena hobane letlalo la hae le meroboko sa dinawa tsa sopho tse sootho.
Subtitle: null
Title: Poone le Dinawa
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Ka mantswe a mofuthu a bonolo, mohapi wa moputso wa kgotso wa Nobel, Desmond Tutu o tshwaretse bana bohle, hohle moo ba leng teng molaetsa wa hore ba ratane ba tshwarelane.\r\n\r\n“Lekgabunyane le ratehang la Ntate Modimo,o lora ditoro dife tse monatenate, bosiu ha o robetse? Ana o lora o phaphalletse hodimodimo marung kapa  mookoding, o kgabisitseng lehodimo?”
Subtitle: null
Title: Toro Ya Ntate Modimo
Author: Desmond Tutu; Douglas Carlton Abrams

Description: Nkgono Podi o laya dipotsantyane tsa hae tse supileng hore di se ke tsa bulela lefiritshwana ha a tswile. Lefiritshwana le masene le leka kahohlehohle ho qhekanyetsa dipotsanyane tseo hore di le bulele! Ana dipotsanyane di tla kgona ho phema maqheka a lefiritshwana? Hona ke mang ya maqheka ho feta e mong qetellong?
Subtitle: null
Title: Lefiritshwana le Dipotsanyane tse Supileng
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Motshwasi wa ditlhapi ya futsanehileng o dula le ngwanabo ntlong ya jwang, pela lewatle. Ka letsatsi le leng motshwasi wa ditlhapi o ile a tshwasa tlhapi ya mehlolo e tsebang ho buwa, mme a e lokolla hang hang. O ile a qoqela ngwanabo ka sena mme ngwanabo a re a kgutlele tlhaping eo, a e kope hore e ba fe ntlo e kgolo e majabajaba. Tlhapi ya mehlolo e ile ya phethahatsa kopo ya motshwasi wa ditlhapi. Ana ngwanabo o tla kgotsofala kapa o meharo mme o tla batla tse ngata ho feta moo?
Subtitle: null
Title: Tlhapi ya Mehlolo
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Ena ke pale ya bobedi e mabapi le namane ya Bokone E NTLE e bitswang Masedi. Ke pale ya borikgwe bo BOLELELE boo a neng a bo filwe. Lebitso la hae ha le feletse ke 'Masedi Pakeng tsa Makala'. O rehilwe lebitso lena hobane o shebeha e ka o dutse moriting wa sefate mme letsatsi le etsa matheba letlalong la hae.
Subtitle: null
Title: Borikgwe bo Bolelele
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Pale ena eo o tlo e bala e ne e phetelwe mongodi ke e mong wa bapalami ba tekesi kgetlo la pele sehlekehlekeng sa Comores. Ke pale e phetwang hohle ho phatlalla le Afrika. Ke pale ya batho bohle ba phelang Afrika.
Subtitle: null
Title: Metswalle e meraro le tekesi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Ayanda e monnyane o rata ntatae ka pelo ya hae yohle. Ka letsatsi le leng a tsamaya, mme a se hlole a kgutla. O utlwile bohloko hoo a qetileng ka hore ha a rate ho hola. Kahoo a dula a le monnyane nako e telele, le ha metswalle e ne e bapala ka yena. Mmae a kula ka le leng, yaba o fetola mohopolo wa hae. A ba moholo hore a tsebe ho thusa lelapa la habo. Empa ha bothata bo hlaha motseng wa habo, na o moholo le ho ba sebete ho lekaneng ho sireletsa bohle?
Subtitle: null
Title: Ngwananyana ya neng a sa rate ho hola
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: Kgohonyana e Kgubedu o ikutlwa a lapile mme o nahana ho etsa borotho. A etsa lenane la dintho tse a tla di hloka mme a tsohella hoseng tsatsing le tjhabileng. A kopa metswalle ho mo thusa empa bohle ba re tjhe! Ebe o tla tshwanela ho etsa tsohle ka boyena?
Subtitle: null
Title: Kgohonyana e kgubedu
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Letatana la batho le lebe le shebahala le fapane haholo ho matatana a mang. Lelapa la habo la matata le a mo tsheha mme le etsa hore a ikutlwe a sa batlwe leha yena a batla feela ho ratwa le ho ba e mong wa bona. Kahoo o a baleha mme o nka leeto le le lelele le bodutung. Na ebe o sa tla ratwa le ho amohelwa ka seo a leng sona
Subtitle: null
Title: Letatana le lebe
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: Diphooko tse Tharo tsa Gruff (sefane se bolelang hore ke difelapelwana) di lapile hape di kgathetse ke ho dula naheng a lerole e nang le meutlwa. Ka nqane ho borokgo ho na le lerallana le nang le jwang bo hlabosang, boo di lakatsang ho bo ja. Empa di tshaba kgodumodumo e bohale e dulang ka tlasa borokgo. Ka tsatsi le leng ba lapa haholo hoo ba ileng ba qeta ka hore ba tla ba sebete mme ba tshele borokgo. Na ba tla kgona ho hlola kgodumodumo kapa e tla ba tshwara mme e ba kwenye?
Subtitle: null
Title: Diphooko tse Tharo tsa Gruff
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Buka ena e ruileng ka ditshwantsho e bolela kamoo Thabo le ntatae ba etsang khaete ka teng. Ha ba ntse ba e fofisa, thapo ya yona ya kgaoha ya tlohela khaete ho tsamaya leeto le leholo ho parola le Afrika. Ho tloha diphororong tsa Victoria Falls tse dumadumang le ditsullung tsa mahlwa tsa Kilimanjaro, ho ya mahwatateng a Sahara le Diphiramiti tsa seholoholo tsa Egypt, latela ho fofa ha khaete ka hodima mekolokotwane e meholo ya Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Ho fofa ha Khaete
Author: William Gumede

Description: Namane e nyane ya Nguni e ne e kgathatsehile. ‘Nna ha ke motle,’ e realo ho Mme Kgomo ya Nguni.
Subtitle: null
Title: Kgomo e ntle ya Nguni
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Lele is a very imaginative little boy. When he dreams, the world has no boundaries. He travels from the night sky, down to the sea and back up to the clouds. Join Lele on his journey as he makes friends with the stars, the fish and other young dreamers.
Subtitle: null
Title: Lele o a lora
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Dangos wakes up on Monday morning with a dreadful sneeze. Her Aunty wants to take special care of her and so Dangos misses out on climbing trees, making dolls, playing with her friends and fishing with her uncle. Will she be able to catch up all the fun things she has missed by the end of the week?
Subtitle: null
Title: Aowa!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Zaza has a very busy and exciting day. From getting up, to singing and story time, it is always time for something fun! Join Zaza in her daily routine and find out all the interesting things she does.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ke nako!
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Lele is very busy today. He makes his way through his house asking each family member, “What are you doing?” Finally, it is dinnertime and Lele is nowhere to be found. Join Lele as he learns about reading and writing and why both are important everyday skills.
Subtitle: null
Title: O dira eng?
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: The rules to crossing the road are taught to children from a young age. Emiša, lebelela gomme o theeletše! uses well-known African animals, including monkeys, zebras and giraffes, to teach children the rules of the road, showing them how important it is to obey them.
Subtitle: null
Title: Emiša, lebelela gomme o theeletše!
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: This is the story of how quick-thinking Zebra tricks the hungry Hyena into not eating him for dinner, with very prickly results. A delightful tale with striking paper collage illustrations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Pitsi le Phiri
Author: Lesley Geekie Dawe

Description: Thandi o nyaka dieta tše diswa, mme o tseba gabotse gore di tla turela Koko wa gagwe. Ka gona, mmogo ba loga leano la go hwetša tšhelete ka thušo ye nnyane go tšwa go Nosipho, mpopi wa gagwe le Pepi yoo e lego mokoko wa gagwe wa seruiwaratwa.
Subtitle: null
Title: Tšhekge-tšhekge ka morabeng wa ka
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Thandi le mpopi wa gagwe Nosipho ba lora ka bophelo bjo bo kaone, eupša ba lemoga gore lerato la makgolo wa Thandi le di feta ka moka.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nka ba kae goba kae
Author: Catherine Groenewald

Description: Batswadi ba Thandi ba hlokofete ka lebaka la AIDS, gomme o swanetše go yo dula le makgolwagwe. Megopolo ka lapa labo e tšwelela ka nako yeo a dirago mpopo wo o ikgethilego – mpopo wo o dirilwego ka “diaparo tša mankgeretla” eupša ke mang a bontšhago Thandi gore a ka hwetša khomotšo le tshepo bjang.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nosipho o tla go dula
Author: Sarah Oosthuizen

Description: As Mama watches from afar, Tebogo visits the animals in her world, looking for a new friend. In this gorgeously illustrated book, the story introduces young children, between 2 and 7, to many animals, from Mischievous Cat to Crazy Crocodile, at the same time promoting a love for reading. Which animal will Asanda choose to be her friend? Children can also interact with the book by hunting for the ants on every page.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mogwera wa Tebogo
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: The world is full of shapes. Everywhere you look you see circles, triangles and squares. This is a beautifully illustrated book that provides children with a wonderful and fun way to learn about shapes from the world around us.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dibopego di mo  gohle
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Ye ke nonwane ya boraro ka ga NAMANYANA e botsana e Phaswana ye e bitšwago Dikgoba. Ga bjale, Dikgoba le motswala wa gagwe Nawa ba nyaka go bjala mahea le dinawa gore ba tsenele Pontšho ya Balemi. A ba tla fenya moputso wa puno ye kaonekaone?\r\n\r\nLeina la Dikgoba la therešo ke ‘Dikgoba Makgatheng ga Makala’. Se ke ka lebaka la gore e bonala o ka re e dutše ka fase ga morithi wa mohlare, gomme letšatši le dira morithi mo mokgopa. Leina la nnete la Nawa ke “Nawa” ka gore mokgopa wa yona o swana le nawa ya go ba le maronthothwane.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mahea le Dinawa
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Ana o ka kgolwa hore ho na le polasi ka hara Cape Town? Matata, dikgaka, dikolobe, dinku le dikgomo di phela mmoho polasing ya Andre, bohole bo seng bokae feela ho tloha bohareng ba toropo.\r\n\r\nBala ka Lynne le ntja ya hae Famous mohla ba thusang ho kgannela dikgomo tsa Andre tse lahlehileng, lapeng.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dikgomo mmileng
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: Ungakholelwa ukuba kukho ifama embindini weKapa? Amadada, amarhanisi, iihagu, iigusha neemazi zenkomo zihlala kwifama ka-André, cebu nje kancinci kumbindi weso sixeko.\r\n\r\nFunda ngoLynne nangenja yakhe enguFamous, nangemini abazithatha ngayo iimazi zenkomo zika-André bazibuyisela kwikhaya lazo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukubuyisela iinkomo ekhaya
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: Ungakholwa ukuthi kunepulazi phakathi eCape Town? Amadada, amahansi, izingulube, izimvu nezinkomo zihlala epulazini lika-André, eliseduze nesenta yedolobha.\r\n\r\nFunda ngoLynne nenja yakhe, uFamous mhlazane bebuyisela ekhaya izinkomo zika-André ezabe zilahlekile.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukubuyisela izinkomo ekhaya
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: A o ka dumela gore go na le polase mo bogareng jwa Cape Town? Dipidipidi, diganse, dikolobe, dinku le dikgomo di nna mo polaseng ya ga André, sekgala se sekhutshwane go tswa mo bogareng jwa toropo.\r\n\r\nBuisa ka ga Lynne le ntšwa ya gagwe, Famous, le letsatsi le ba isitseng gae dikgomo tsa ga André, tse di neng di timetse.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dikgomo di isiwa gae
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: A o ka kgolwa gore go na le polasa ka gare ga Cape Town? Mapidibi, magantshe, dikolobe, dinku le dikgomo di dula mo polaseng ya André, ke leetonyana\r\n\r\nGo tšwa ka bogareng bja toropo. Bala ka ga Lynne le mpša ya gagwe, Famous, le letšatši leo ba išago dikgomo tša André tšeo di bego di timetše gae.
Subtitle: null
Title: Go iša dikgomo gae
Author: Reviva Schermbrucker; Lynne Lomofsky; André Laubscher

Description: Ye ke nonwane ya bobedi ka ga NAMANYANA e botsana e Phaswana yeo e bitšwago Dokgoba. Yona e ka ga para ya marokgo a MATELELE ao e bego e filwe ona. Leina la gagwe la nnete ke 'Dokgoba Makgatheng ga Makala'. Se ke ka lebka la gore o ka re e dutše morithing wa mohlare, gomme letšatši le dira merithi ka lehlakoreng la yona.
Subtitle: null
Title: Borokgo bjo Botelele
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Nonwane ye o tlilego go e bala, e anegetšwe mongwadi la mathomo ke mohlahli wa baeti wa selegae ka thekising, ka dihlakahlakeng tša Comores. Ke nonwane yeo e anegwago ka Aforika ka bophara, go tloga Nigeria go ya Comores le go fihla ka Aforika-Borwa. Ke nonwane yeo e lego ya Aforika ka moka le batho ba yona.
Subtitle: null
Title: Bagwera ba bararo le thekisi
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description: Ayanda yo monnyane o rata tatagwe ka pelo ya gagwe ka moka. Ka letšatši le lengwe o ile a sepela, gomme a se boe. O ile a nyama gomme a tšea sephetho sa gore ga a nyake go gola. Ka fao a dula e le yo monnyane lebaka le le telele, le ge bagwera ba gagwe ba mo kwera. Ka letšatši le lengwe mmagwe o ile a babja gomme a fetola monagano wa gagwe. A gola ya ba yo mogologolo gore a kgone go thuša balapa la gagwe. Eupša ge mathata a fihlela motsana wa gabo, a o gotše le go ba le bonatla go go lekanego go phološa mang le mang?
Subtitle: null
Title: Mosetsana yo monnyane wa go se nyake go gola
Author: Véronique Tadjo

Description: Kgogo ye Nnyane ya Sethole e ikwa e nvaka kobola ka fao ya tšea sephetho sa dira borotho. Ya dira lenaneo la seo se tla nyakegago gomme ya wela tsela mo mesong ya go ba le letšatši. Ya kgopela bagwera ba yona gore ba mo thuše gomme ka moka ba re aowa! A e swanetše go dira dilo ka moka ka boyona?
Subtitle: null
Title: Kgogo ye Nnyane ya Sethole ye Khubedu
Author: Margie Orford

Description: Lepidibidi la batho la go befa le be le sa swane le mapidibidi a mangwe. Balapa la gabo la mapidibidi le be le mo kwera e bile le dira gore le ikwe le sa nyakege le ge lona le be le nyaka go ratwa le go amogelwa. Ka fao le ile la tšhaba gomme la tšea leeto le le telele le nnoši. A le tla ka la tsoga le ratilwe le go amogelwa go ba seo le lego sona?
Subtitle: null
Title: Lepidibidi la go Befa
Author: Sindiwe Magona

Description: Diphooko tše Tharo tša go Tshwenya di swerwe ke tlala e bile di lapišitšwe ke go phela mo lešokeng la lerole le meetlwa. Ka mošola wa leporogo go na le thabana yeo e khupeditšwego ke bjang bjo bo bose, bjo bo tala bjoo di nyakago go bo fula. Eupša di tšhaba kgokomodumo ye e bogale yeo e dulago ka fase ga leporogo. Ka letšatši le lengwe di be di swerwe ke tlala kudu gomme tša tšea sephetho sa go ba bogale gomme tša tshela leporogo. A di tla hlalefetša kgokomodumo goba e tla di swara le go di kometša?
Subtitle: null
Title: Diphooko tše Tharo tša go Tshwenya
Author: Carole Bloch

Description: Puku ye e humilego ka diswantšho e bolela nonwane ya ge Peter le tatagwe ba dira khaete. Ge ba dutše ba fofiša khaete, thapo ya khaete e ile ya thaoga gomme ya lokolla khaete go tšea leeto la go putla Afrika. Go tšwa go modumo wa Diphororo tša Victoria le dintlhoa tša lehlwa tša Kilimanjaro, go ya go maganata a Sahara le Diphiramiti tša kgalekgale tša Egepeta, go latela phofo ya khaete go dinaga tše dingwe tše bohlokwa tša Afrika!
Subtitle: null
Title: Phofo ya Khaete
Author: William Gumede

Description: Namanyana e Phaswa e be e tshwenyegile. ‘Ga ke kgahliše lehono,’ ya realo go Mma Kgomo Phaswana.
Subtitle: null
Title: Namanyana e botsana e Phaswa
Author: Maryanne Bester

Description:
These five imaginative trails capture the magic of nature within Kirstenbosch, South Africa’s best-known botanical garden. Eager young adventurers will have hours of fun discovering prehistoric gems, enchanted forests, secret gardens, mysterious mirror pools and much more.

Each route description is accompanied by a map and beautiful photographs and illustrations, while the text is packed with information about striking and surprising trees, flowers, birds, insects, animals and tidbits from history, as well as descriptions of the best places to play and relax.

This whimsical guide is a must-have companion for any young adventurer setting off into Cape Town's much-loved garden.
Subtitle: null
Title: Adventure Trails in Kirstenbosch
Author: Daphne Mackie

Description:
Whales played in the ocean below the cliff paths where Ben and Grandpa had often walked. The windswept milkwood was their lookout. “Mysterious and magnificent creatures,” Grandpa would say, “flying giants of the sea!” Together they read stories about whales, made new pages for Grandpa’s scrapbook, or went to the museum to see the whale skeleton. But just before summer things changed: Grandpa stayed in bed . . . days passed. And then Grandpa died. 
 
Noticing that Ben finds it hard to say good bye, Dad takes Ben to the milkwood where Ben and Grandpa would often sit, and tells him a story: Long ago a whale-calf was born in their bay. Every day he frolicked and swam with his mother and an old humpback whale, but when the time came for the whales to travel back south, the old whale could not make the journey with the others. The whale calf had to say good bye too.
 
This gentle story on bereavement will strike a chord with both children and adults alike.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ben and the Whales
Author: Ingrid Mennen

Description: This humorous and incisive collection of poetry celebrates the joys of childhood and of being a father. Paul Benjamin captures in verse his delight at sharing the world with his son. From family outings to cricket on the lawn, sharing time with each other and the heartache of saying goodbye, Dad, don’t go to work will be loved by parents and children alike. Ideal for reading aloud or quiet enjoyment, this collection will nurture lovers of life, children and words.
Subtitle: null
Title: Dad, don't go to work
Author: Paul Benjamin

Description:
This early reader/picture book follows the adventures of Antjie, a little girl of eight, as she wanders through her village of Genadendal searching for her lost donkeys. 

Beautiful full-colour photographs introduce the reader to the rhymes, characters and places which make up life in a sleepy dorp in the Overberg. The aim of the book is to both affirm the experiences of rural children and to introduce urban children to a lifestyle different from their own.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Antjie
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
From when he wakes up in the dark bed he shares with his sister, till late afternoon when he meets his dance partner at the local hall, we follow Mhlanguli's activities, sharing in the vibrant life of township dwellers in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. 

What is is it about the number three that Mhlanguli has to remember?

Young children will be eager to discover the answer to this as they enjoy the full-colour photographs that accompany the simple text.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Mhlanguli
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: This book focuses on a boy who attends an ex-Model C school in Cape Town. The art teacher has set the class a project: \"Draw a picture on every day of the week showing what you and your family do\". Some of what he does reflects his Muslim background, such as attending Madressah, and some are the general interests of many boys his age - cricket, swimming and family meals.\r\n\r\nLanguages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Azhar
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: Zimkhitha lives in Gobozana, a small village in the Eastern Cape. When the children of the village need their ball rescued from Sis'Nokuphumlas' yard, it is Zimkhitha with her special qualities who is needed. But where is Zimkhitha? This book shows some of the games, interests and responsibilities of rural children.\r\n\r\nLanguages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Zimkhitha
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: Cindy Khambule lives in Berea, Johannesburg. The book explores the lifestyles of children who live in flats, whose parents both work and who must catch taxis or trains with her siblings to get to school, children whose playgrounds are inner city parks.\r\n\r\nLanguages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Cindy
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
ELRU's latest children's book follows a family from Louwville near Vredenbrug as they drive through the West Coast on a family outing. 

The journey, depicted in colour photographs is rich in science, math, and life experiences. The text throughout is colour coded in the three official languages of the Western Cape: Xhosa, Afrikaans, and English. Ideas and information for parents and teachers are provided at the back of the book. Although the journey takes place in the Western Cape of South Africa, the book is relevant to all young children and their families.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Endleleni, On the Road, Op die Pad
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Young children naturally learn maths and science on an outing to the sea. 

Follow a group of children as they play in the sand, interact with fishermen and observe the natural world on Paternoster, a small fishing and holiday village on the West Coast. This series of books encourages children to see the outside world as the biggest and richest classroom that they have. Ideas and information for parents and teachers appear at the back.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Elwandle, By the Sea, By die See
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Visiting a national park that boasts a major river is a maths and science experience for young children. 

Follow a group of pre-schoolers as they are led by a park ranger from the Bontebok Park along the banks of the Breede River. This series encourages children to see their environment through different eyes. Ideas and information for parents and teachers is provided at the back.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Ecaleni Komlambo, Along the River, Rivierlangs
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
There are many opportunities for informal maths and science learning when a family visits the interesting mountainous area above the Pakhuis Pass. 

The area is a natural wonderland and is rich in San rock art. Read this book and enjoy a fun and educational experience in the mountains. This series of books encourages children to experience the environment as their teacher. Ideas and information for parents and teachers are provided at the back.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Ezintabeni, In the Mountains, In die Berge
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Wow! The city of Cape Town is so interesting and who knew that there was so much to learn when you visit it. 

Come and experience the city with Sharman, Thaddeus and Joshua and find out just how much we can learn by having fun and exploring the world around us.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Edolophin, In the City, In die Stad
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: Indulge in nature's finest splendour on an outing to the famous Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden. \r\n\r\nIn this story you can smell the flowers, touch the leaves, see the spiders, hear the birds, taste the water, and count the pebbles. Let the gardens be your teacher for the day.
Subtitle: null
Title: Egadini, In the Garden, In die tuin
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
A visit to a natural history museum is a great opportunity for young children to learn about the fascinating diversity of the natural world and to develop maths and science skills. 

But what if you live far away from city museums? This children's book documents a visit made by the Iziko mobile museum to a preschool in Bredasdorp to provide the children there with stimulation, learning and fun. Ideas and information for parents and teachers are provided at the back of the book.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: A Museum Visit
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Science is all around us, including in our homes. Join the twins, Chander and Koresh and their friend's, Jed and Mbasa, on a visit to Sisi Nokwezis. 

There the twin's mother will teach them all [and us] how much science is a part of our everyday lives. Even better, we all discover that science can be both enriching and fun. This book also includes valuable information for teachers and parents about how to explain some of the basics of science to children.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans
Subtitle: null
Title: Science Alive in the Home
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: In \"At school, What if...? Ncebakazi is about to start \"big school\". In discussions with her mother she expresses her concerns e.g. \"What if the teacher shouts all the time? What if I can't get to the toilet in time? What if there are many stairs to climb?\" Some of these could be the concerns of any child starting school, some are more specific to Ncebakazi's disability- she has Spina Bifida and has special physical needs.
Subtitle: null
Title: At School What If...?
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: \"They were Wrong!\" debunks a range of widely held stereotypes and dentists are men, people who do yoga are weird, people from other countries are aliens. These are not the firm opinions of the main character of the book, Mikhail, aged 9, but those that he gleans from adults and older children in his environment.
Subtitle: null
Title: They Were Wrong
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
“Am I a Lion that Eats People?” is the third in ELRU's Mielie series of picture books whose aim it is to support children in developing and deepening their understanding of human rights. 

It is the thorny topic of the unjust discri-mination shown towards people who are HIV positive or have AIDS that is tackled in this book. The main characters in the story, Mawabo and his mother, both HIV positive, talk about their feelings, frustrations, hopes and fears. 

The image of a lion frightening yet brave becomes a symbol for both the fear that AIDS engenders and the bravery of those living with HIV.
Subtitle: null
Title: Am I a Lion that Eats People?
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: All children hate to wait till supper is cooked, to wait until their favourite aunt arrives or to wait for their birthday seems like an ordeal, but for Lihle Ketani, the 8-year-old resident of Langa, Cape Town, and the main character of the 4th book in ELRU's Mielie Books Series, waiting is much more than that. “Ukulinda, ukulinda, okoko ulindile. Waiting, waiting, always waiting”, she says to herself. “We are waiting for our house to be built. I am waiting for a bed all for myself. I am waiting for Mama to get money”.
Subtitle: null
Title: Waiting, Waiting, Always Waiting...
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Speel Saam in Die Hantam is much more than just a story of a farm and town children having fun. It provides many ideas and concepts for teachers, parents, and children which include maths, science, life-skills and, of course, literacy. 

Readers, regardless of cultural and language diversity are challenged to identify and use these ideas and concepts at school as well as at home. 

For those who have and those who would like to explore the unique Karoo town of Calvinia, this could also make an interesting coffee-table reader.
Subtitle: null
Title: Speel Saam in die Hantam
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: Set in one of the many colourful townships in Cape Town, this book introduces the concept of sound to the young reader. Bongo explores the sounds of the everyday things he encounters in his environment.
Subtitle: null
Title: Bongo at Home
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: In this picture book/early reader photographs of front doors and house facades are twinned with interior shots of families doing the kind of things families do together: reading, eating, cooking meals, putting away groceries and simply chatting.\r\n\r\nLanguages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Knock! Knock!
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description: In this book the skilled hands of a young boy collect twenty eight precious beads and one pink shell to string into a necklace.\r\n\r\nLanguages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, Tswana & Zulu, S. Sotho, N. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: String Together
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
Everyday sayings in Xhosa, English, S. Sotho and Afrikaans. Illustrated with vibrant, imaginative drawings in full-colour, this book aims to build bridges between cultures and languages. 

"Uthini?" introduces children who read or speak any of the four languages to a sprinkling of humorous images conjured up by such sayings as "it's raining cats and dogs" or "you are jumping into my mouth". 

One of the Children's Book Forum, South African Honour Books 1997.

Languages: Xhosa, English, Afrikaans, S. Sotho, English
Subtitle: null
Title: Uthini?
Author: Early Learning Resource Unit (ELRU)

Description:
This lovely story is certain to warm your heart,
It is a story about a Panda whose polkadots set her apart.
It is an adventure full of laughter, a fantasy full of glee,
It is a story about the dottiest Panda you ever will see!
Miranda the Polkadot Panda is a unique, whimsical Children’s Book about a little Panda with a big heart. The colourful, vibrant illustrations and quirky, poetic text combine to create a book that is loved by humans of all ages! This beautifully illustrated story is certain to take a special place in your heart and on your bookshelf. Furthermore, 5% of the proceeds of each of Ani’s books are donated to the WWF to aid in the conservation of endangered species.
Subtitle: null
Title: Miranda the Polkadot Panda
Author: Ani Mallover

Description: Ben and his best friend Tarif love cars. Trouble looms when Ben’s mother experiences car problems.\r\nWhat is the mechanic up to? Why won’t he return the car?\r\nWhat dark secrets will be revealed when Ben and Tarif embark on a dangerous adventure to get the car back?
Subtitle: null
Title: Hotwire
Author: Jay Heale

Description: Ntombi’s mom is out all the time with a new man, Zakes, leaving Ntombi to lookafter her little sister Zinzi. So Ntombi is missing practices for SA’s “Teen Voice” competition and the auditions are getting closer. Besides, Ntombi’s keen to have her own fun, especially once she gets the attention of Mzi, one of Harmony High’s hottest boys. But, what secrets are Zakes and Mzi hiding? How many promises will be broken before Ntombi finds out the truth?
Subtitle: null
Title: Broken Promises
Author: Ros Haden

Description: Mzi wants one thing: revenge. He is full of hatred and anger for his old girlfriend Ntombi and her new boyfriend Olwethu. It was their fault that he was arrested for being part of Zakes’ carjacking gang.\r\nBut now to stay out of jail Mzi can’t make one wrong move. And at Harmony High Mzi no longer gets the respect he once had. Kids who feared him now tease him.\r\nOnly his old friend Vuyo and the sexy Priscilla give him comfort, and encourage him to regain his power by getting back into the world of crime. Will Mzi manage to get his revenge on Olwethu, and still stay out of jail? Or will he be making the biggest mistake of his life?
Subtitle: null
Title: Too Young to Die
Author: Sivuyile Mazantsi, Sam Roth

Description: Why isn't Titi in the photographs in the family photo album? He really wan'ts to know. If he was'nt born yet, then where was he? Titi asks many questions to help him sove this mystery.
Subtitle: null
Title: Why aren't I in the photographs
Author: Kidi Bebey; Christian Kingue Epanya

Description: This little boy wants to grow up really fast. He tells us why he wants to be a grown up, and what he plans to do make to the world a better place
Subtitle: null
Title: When I grow up
Author: Cypien K.M Akuete; Karim Diallo

Description: Ntombi travels to Jozi for the finals of the Teen Voice competition. But it is not a bed of roses. She has left her boyfriend, Olwethu in Cape Town. Her jealous little sister Zinzi is out to make trouble while she’s away. And, she must deal with the other contestants she’s up against: the cool, talented and gorgeous Alex and the nasty twins, Lindiwe and Sindiwe. Thank goodness her room mate Mahlodi can help her make sense of her confusing emotions. (This is a sequel to Broken Promises.)
Subtitle: null
Title: Jealous in Jozi
Author: Dorothy Dyer; Ros Haden

Description: Someone has been writing nasty little lies about 15 year-old Lavender, and she knows – well, she thinks she knows – who it is.\r\nBut before the facts come to light, Lavender will face the darkest side of herself, and shake the entire community with her story.\r\nBattling with the consequences of a night attack, the small-town girl eventually makes the hardest decision of her young life.
Subtitle: null
Title: Capture the light
Author: Jill Morsbach

Description:
The Spy Who Loved Him is a novel about love, work, deception, good friends and difficult decisions …
Thuli Mabena is a journalist on a popular women’s magazine but it all she ever seems to write are reviews of new lipsticks and coffee shops. She longs to write something more serious but she never gets the chance.
Then one day her dream comes true when she is commissioned to write an article about the way that the rich and famous treat their employees. Thuli will have to pretend to be domestic worker for the wealthy businessman Luasi Nkosi, all the while spying on him and reporting back to her readers on what it’s like to work for him.
But Luasi is not what Thuli expected and she is forced to make a very difficult choice between the man she has grown to love and the career she has always wanted.
Subtitle: null
Title: The Spy Who Loved Him
Author: Nollybooks

Description: ‘Hi, Zoleka !’ friends call. But Zoleka has something on her mind. So she walks quietly with her mother and her little brother to church. Will she remember all the words of the verse she has to recite for the Palm Sunday service? This charming story is written by South Africa’s famous storyteller, Gcina Mhlophe.
Subtitle: null
Title: Sawubona, Zoleka!
Author: Gcina Mhlophe

Description: Salma lives with her grandparents on the quiet side of town. At the market she meets Mr Dog, and tells him all about her and her Granny. When Salma realises her mistake it's too late to turn back.\r\nAn African cautionary tale told with fun, humour, and the beat of a drum!
Subtitle: null
Title: Pretty Salma
Author: Niki Daly

Description: Poor Zebby the Zebra! He jumped into a muddy puddle and lost his stripes. His friend Giraffe thinks he’s seen them and knows just where they are. Join them on their quest to find the missing stripes.
Subtitle: null
Title: How Zebby Lost His Stripes
Author: Selu Mdlalose

Description:
AMAYIPHENDLEYA – IsiQalo Sakho Konke tells the story of how four South African teenagers, Kwethu, Jo, Scott and Bobo, began their adventures of discovery in the world of what lies behind the technological wonders of the world today. Physics, mathematics, philosophy, history, culture, and life are just a few aspects of knowledge and its practice that the four encounter along their journey.
With the help of stimulating counsel from their mentor, Uncle Mike, an engineer by training, they form a club through which they begin dedicating their spare time to the search for understanding.
Armed with curiosity and the audacity to ask questions, their mutual interactions (and with Uncle Mike) relentlessly lead them to explore how they can be participators in the world of innovation rather than being spectators and mere consumers. They draw inspiration from real-life examples of innovators such as Trevor Baylis who, when confronted with the dire need for mass communications in Africa, went on to invent the wind-up radio and the associated technologies.
AMAYIPHENDLEYA – IsiQalo Sakho Konke is a story of how everyone can cultivate a dream and an innovative mind, and how even teenagers can begin taking the necessary baby steps toward making a difference in their own world.
Subtitle: null
Title: AmaYiphendleya - IsiQalo Sakho Konke
Author: Phiwayinkosi G Mbuyazi

Description: Two little girls are fascinated by a beautiful woman they meet at a market. They want to be just like her. But what is her secret?
Subtitle: null
Title: Beautiful Debo
Author: Beatrice Lalinon Gbado; Ponce E Kokou Zannou

Description: When war forces people to leave their homes, children often get lost. And that's what happens to Afi. But luckily, she meets an old man with a big heart and ... a magic drum.
Subtitle: null
Title: Afi and the magic drum
Author: Thecla Midiohouan; Hector D. Sonon

Description: Can you? is a brightly illustrasted playful and joyful little book that will make readers of all ages smile. It's clever use of repetition and humour as well as its focus on the familiar will get young children moving and reading.
Subtitle: null
Title: Can You
Author: Carole Bloch; Wendy Hardie

Description: Zebby wa pitse ya naga we! O tloletse mo seretseng a bo a latlhegelwa ke mebala ya gagwe. Tsala ya gagwe Thutlwa o akanya gore o itse kwa e leng teng. A ruri o ka mo thusa go e senka?
Subtitle: null
Title: E Ile Kae Mebala Ya Ga Zebby
Author: Selu Mdlalose

Description: UMusa loThoko bacela ugogoMabhena ukuthi kumbe bangapenda njalo bafake imibala etshiye tshiyeneyo lamapetheni emdulwini ngaphandle kokuthi yonke into kayisahanga ngendlela obekumiswe ngayo kulendaba ehlekisayo.\r\n\r\nMusa and Thoko ask Gogo Mabhena if they can help her paint her house and make magic colours and patterns on the wall. Except not everything quite goes to plan in this fun story.
Subtitle: null
Title: Amasalamusi KaMabhena
Author: Grace Dube

Description: How Zebby Lost His Stripes is a delightful story that uses shapes, colours and patterns to search for Zebby’s lost stripes.\r\n\r\nPoor Zebby the Zebra! He jumped into a muddy puddle and lost his stripes. His friend Giraffe thinks he’s seen them and knows just where they are. Join them on their quest to find the missing stripes.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ayengaphi Amabala kaZebby
Author: Selu Mdlalose

Description: Yini enza umsindo lowo phakhathi kobusuku. Indaba ehlabusayo ephathelane ngezinto ezenziwa nguDonkana ubabhemi.
Subtitle: null
Title: Hamba Khatshana Donkana
Author: Grace Dube

Description: Landela uThemba ehambweni lwakhe lomama wakhe khanye lodadewabo uSuku besiyabona ubaba wakhe eGoli kukhisimusi. Kholisa ubumnandi bo hambo lobu ekuqaleni behamba ngenqola, kuze beseKombini ekucineni ngesitimela.
Subtitle: null
Title: Sivakatshela UBaba
Author: Grace Dube

Description: If you make fun of others, you will suffer for it one day! That's what happened to Nana when she met the ernormous caterpillar. But when the caterpillar changes into a beautiful butterfly, Nana learns that she too can change.
Subtitle: null
Title: Nana and the Catepillar
Author: Ousmane Diarra; Virginie Desmoulins

Description: Vuyo is a little South African boy who loves to play! Young children everywhere will enjoy the text and delightfully detailed ilustrations, which describe the things he enjoys playing with - and how he loves playing with other children more!
Subtitle: null
Title: Vuyo's Day
Author: Carole Bloch; Meg Jordi

Description: Based on African legend, Modjadji, the Rain Queen tells the story of Modjadji's arrival in drought-stricken Venda land, where the young children have never seen rain. To everyone's delight, Modjadji uses her magical powers to produce rain. Soon the land turns green, and the people of Venda land are healthy and happy again.
Subtitle: null
Title: Modjadji the Rain Queen
Author: Retold by Donve

Description: Peggy so much wants to be special an different to all the other mice in the playground, and it takes her a while to realise how special she really is this is also a great ‘starting school’ story.
Subtitle: null
Title: Peggy's Smile
Author: Kaanitah Cassim; Monde Mraji

Subtitle: null
Title: Bohloko ba maikutlo
Author: R.N. Phume

O teana le Isanusi nahathote mme Isanusi sena se mmolella ditaba tshohle tse tlang ho mo etsahalla tseleng ena ya bophelo. Qetellong o fumana seo e leng kgale a se labalabela mme o itjella poqo ka hlanaka, o ja ....

Subtitle: null
Title: Diwediwetla - Sesotho poetry
Author: A Tsotetsi, et al

She passes the auditions for the position of soloist in the choir which will take part at the celebration of the tenth anniversary of the Freedom of South Africa. This success motivates her and she becomes more determined to improve her music career.
Subtitle: null
Title: Ha ditswere di tsanyaola
Author: KPD Maphalla

Description: null

Title: Ha re bapaleng Nursery Rhymes Book
Author: T.E. Mokone

Title: Hlwaya tsebe
Author: N. P. Maake; M. Maake

Title: Ke llela ho wena
Author: NP Maake

Subtitle: null
Title: Kgatsela
Author: M. M. Makappa

Description: Ke morutwana ya fuwang tshehetso haholo ke mmae. O kena sekolo sekolong se atileng ka ditlokotsebe tsa barutwana ba sebedisang dithethefatsi. O wela lerabeng la bona hoo a etsang qeto ya ho inehela. Ka ho etsa qeto e jwalo e ne e se e le ha a lahlile maikemisetso le ditoro tsa hae tsa bophelo. O qetella a sebedisa dithethefatsi ho fihlela a thunngwa, a ba a holofala letheka. Na o sa hopola mantswe ana: “…Nna ha ke batle ho bona motho selaong sa ka. Ke re e ka ba motsheare kapa bosiu ho tshwana feela. Nna ke a kgwephetsa, ke a budula.”

Title: Mabinabine a pelo
Author: S. J. Gambu

Author: E. M. R. Mahlasela

Description: Mamela melodi ke buka e ntle haholo ya dithothokiso tsa bangodi ba batjha le ba kgale. Yona e kgothaleditswe boqapi ba mofuta ono ke mokgatlo wa bangodi wa Metjodi. Lebakabaka e ntse e hlile e le hona ho qhwaella mefuta ena ya bangodi ka lemao le le leng hore ba be kobo e ka aparehang. Tshepo ke hore ka le leng la matsatsi bano ba ntseng ba thuthua le bona bat la ikemela boqaping. Lekola boka ena kahare o tle o kopane le bangodi ba kgale ba kang ntate L. Z. Malimabe, Dr K.P.D. Maphalla, Jim Mokoena le ba bang. Ho feta moo, o tla iponela le dipotso tsa tataiso tse morwerwe ka mongodi wa dilemo, ntate Lanny Mokwena. Kahara dithothokiso tsena ho na le tsa lerato, tsa tayo, tsa kgalemo, tsa maikutlo le tse jwalo.
Subtitle: null
Title: Mamela Melodi
Author: K. P. D. Maphalla

Description: Ena buka ya dithothokiso, ke ya thothokiso tsa lona bana. Ke ya tsona tse bonojana, tse lekaneng lona. Ithuteng tsona, di le natefele. Ho tsona, le tla ithuta tse molemo, tse molemo puong ya Sesotho. Etswe thothokiso; ke lejwe la bohlokwa la motheo phelong ba ngwana e mong le e mong. Ithuteng le ntse le natefelwa ke tsona thothokiso tsena tsa lona.
Subtitle: null

Description:
“Chameleon, you’re so ugly that you’re a disgrace to us all!” is the continual cry of the river community.

Over time, Chameleon comes to believe their cruel words.  Lonely and hopeless, he dreads the dawning of every new day.  But fate intervenes and he meets a lark and an old man who set in motion events that transform him. The insecurity of the Chameleon and the unkind behaviour of the river community will strike a chord with both young and old.

Chameleon’s well-deserved triumph at the end of the story is a welcome surprise – his belief in himself is restored and his song will touch the hearts of many and his spirit, inspire many more.

The Singing Chameleon is an inspirational and compelling retelling of a Malawian tale by internationally respected author and storyteller, Gcina Mhlophe, with bright and bold illustrations by well-known artist, Kalle Becker.

Also available in Afrikaans, Sesotho, Xhosa and Zulu.

Description: Lencwadi yinovela etlolwe nguSkosana NE ekhuluma ngommongo-ndaba ojayelekileko ongenelela ukungathembeki komuntu. Indaba yenzeka kwelinye lamabhoduluko aqakathekileko esitjhabeni samaNdebele, KwaNomtjherhela. UMaqhinga noMarhwayeja balingisi ababili abaqakathekileko abagebengana ngehlabathi esaluju leenyosi nomukhwa wokubazwa. Ngesimanga sokungathembeki komuntu indaba ikhamba ifake nokuloyana. The novelette handles the theme of untrustworthiness. The story occurs in one of the most important areas of amaNdebele, KwaNomtjherhela. Maqhinga and Marhwayeja are the two main characters that trick each other using sand that looks like honey and a knife that is crafted from a wood.

Description: Lenoedlana imumethe indaba emanqophana nokuthatha umfazi. UMsongelwa lisokana elizimisele ukuthatha isiphalaphala somntazana yesintu, isiNdebele, ukube umntazanakhe lo, uzibuyela esigoga la amasiko sele ahloywa khona babantu abanzima, ngesibanga sabamhlophe. Ekugcinenei lendatjana itjengisa ukungakhambisi izinto ngendlela yesiko lomuntu. Ngena ngaphakathi-ke mfundi uzizwele bona uMsongelwe uphumelela njani ukuzibona ahlezi nokakhe, uZinto, ekugcineni azifunyane arareke komhlolo ngesibanga sethando bakwethu. Hawu madoda, lisani ithando. This novelette follows Msongelwa's pursuit to find a wife and get married. He likes a beautiful young woman called Zinto, but Msongelwa still follows traditional isiNdebele culture, while Zinto believs firmly in western culture. tension arises when it becomes clear tha Msongelwa's wishes to marry Zinto may be hindered by their cultural differences. this compelling story explores how the lovers deal with their problem of cultural differences.

Description: Ungizwa Ngendaba inovedlana esamumethe ummongo-ndaba orhunyeziweko owethulwa yinovela yesihloko esithi, 'Mumuntu-ke Loyo'. Itlolwe ngokufanela abafundi bebanga le-7 ngombana ngemva kwesinye nesinye isahlukwana kunemibuzo ehlola umfundi ngokuzwisisa kwakhe indaba. Ungizwa Ngendaba is an abridged version of Mumuntu-ke Loyo, written by NE Skosana. The theme is about human untrustworthiness, but versioned for the Grade 7 learner. After each chapter, specific questions are asked to assess the reader's understanding of the story.

Description: Ifa Lethu Lemangweni details the absorbing reminiscences of an experienced game ranger, Dabulamanzi. A keen observer of animals in their natural habitat, Dabulamanzi gives an enriching account of their constant interaction and of nature's abundant variety. This novel highlights the intrinsic value of nature, its ability to offer solace and to foster harmonious co-existence.

Description:
Lapha kuhlangana neentandani ezimbini uLucky kanye no Bantazi umntazana
kanye nesokana, kanti unina lomntana uNaSindana okunguye umraranisi
wawowoke umraro ongaphakathi kwencwa-jana samdlalo lo. Into ekulu
ngile yokuthi uNaSindana lo umuntu ongathandi bona umkhelwana wakho
uNaMtshweni othethwe kwaMbonani angarageli phambili ngokwenzela
abantwana bakhe okuhle khulukhulu ngokuthi baphothule ngemfundweni zabo.
Okunye bekangafuni khulukhulu bona uLucky athathe umntwanakhe uBantazi,
yeke njengombana ithando linekani, bagine bathathene bebabanomntwana,
ngekungcineni unina kaBantazi wagcina ezibonile iimphoso zakhe
lokhokwatjengisa ukuthi kuhle-kuhle ISITHA SOMUNTU singubani yeke
uNaSindane ngakuye inyanga yembulwa mamafu.
A drama about the role that parents play in their children’s love lives. Lucky and
Bantazi are lovers but Na Sindana, Bantazi’s mother, does not approve of her
daughter’s choice. This drama gives advice to parents who share these challenges
of bringing up their children and provides a window of hope for lovers who are
trapped in the situation of having to choose between their parents and their lovers.

Title: Mom why am I Different?
Author: Matina Genkova-Mpofu

Description: Ha ntwa e quobela batho ho tloha moo ba phelang teng, hangata bana ba a lahleha. Ke sona se ileng sa etsahalla Afi. Empa ka lehloholo o ile a kopana le monnamolo ya pelohlomohi le moropa wa malepa!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Afi le moropa wa malepa
Author: Thecla Midiohouan and Hector D. Sonon

Description: Xa  imfazwe inyanzela abantu ukuba babhace,bawashiye amakhaya abo,kudla ngokubakho intlaninge yabantwana abalahlekayo. Kwenzeke kanye le nto ku-Afi. Kodwa ngethamsanqa wahlangana nexhego elinentliziyo entle negubu lomlingo!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: U-AFI negubu lomlingo
Author: Thecla Midiohouan and Hector D. Sonon

Description: Uma kukhona impi ezweni abantu bebaleka emakhaya abo, izingane zivame ukulahjlekelana nabazali bazo. Lokhu kwenzeka entombazaneni encane u-Afi. Ngenhlanlhla kodwa utholwa ikhehla elinenhiziyo enhle kanye nesigubhu somlingo!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: U-Afi nesigubhu somlingo
Author: Thecla Midiohouan and Hector D. Sonon

Description: Two little girls are fascinated by a beautiful woman they meet at a market. They want to be just like her. But what is her secret?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Beautiful Debo
Author: Beatrice Lalinon Gbado and Ponce E. Kokou Zannou

Description: Twee dogtertjies word gefassineer deur 'n pragtige vrou wat hulle ontmoet. Hulle wil graag soos sy wees. Maar wat is haar geheim?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Pragtige Debo
Author: Beatrice Lalinon Gbado and Ponce E. Kokou Zannou

Description: Banyana ba babedi ba ne ba kgahlilwe ke mosatsana ya motle eo ba ileng ba kopana le yena. Ba lakatsa ho tshwana le yean. Empa lekunutu la hae ke lefe?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmabotle Debo
Author: New Africa Books

Description: Amantombazanyana amabini angabatshana bakaNanfi athe ti iindlebe bubuhle abubone kumfazi othile. Afuna ukufana nalo mfazi. Kodwa ke, ingaba yintoni imfihlo yeli gwiyazana?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Inzwakazi uDebo
Author: Beatrice Lalinon Gbado and Ponce E. Kokou Zannou

Description: Amantombazane amabili ahungwa ubuhle bentokazi ayibona ngelinye ilanga. Afisa ukufana nayo. Kodwa iyini imfihlo yale ntokzai?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Udebo omuhle
Author: Beatrice Lalinon Gbado and Ponce E. Kokou Zannou

Description: Ra-Cat so much wanted to go to school. He knew he would make lots of friends there. But Mom had been drinking from those bottles again. Would that stop Ra-Cat from making new friends?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Brave Little Cat
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Ra-Kat wil so graag skool toe gaan. Hy weet hy sal daar baie maats maak. Maar Mamma het al weer uit daardie bottels gedrink. Beteken dit Ra-Kat nie nuwe maats sal maak nie?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Dapper Katjie
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Ubra-Cat wayefuna kangangani ukuya esikolweni. Wayasazi bona uzakuba nabangani lapho. Kodwana ummakhe bekasela amabhodlelo laya godu. Lokho kungavikela uBra-Cat bona abengani abatjha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ukatswana Onesibindi
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat o be a duma kudu go ya sekolong. O be a tseba gore a ka ba le bagwera ba bantšhi moo. Eupša mmagwe o be a ntše a nwa mapotlelo a gagwe gape. Naa seo se ka šitiša Bra-Cat go humana bagwera ba baswa?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Katse-Katse e Sebete
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat o ne a lakatsa haholo ho ya sekolong. O ne a tseba hore a ka ba le metswalle e mengata moo. Empa mme o ne a ntse a nwa dibotlol tsa hae hape. Na hoo ho ka sitisa Bra-Cat ho iphumanela metswalle e metjha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Katse-Katse e Sebete
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat o ne a lakatsa haholo ho ya sekolong. O ne a tseba hore a ka ba le metswalle e mengata moo. Empa mme o ne a ntse a nwa dibotlol tsa hae hape. Na hoo ho ka sitisa Bra-Cat ho iphumanela metswalle e metjha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Katse-Katse e Sebete
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat o ne a batla thata go ya sekolong. O ne a itse gore o tile go dira ditsala di le dintsi teng. Fela Mme o ntse a nwa go tswa mo mabotlolong ale gape. A seo se tla thibela Bra-Cat go dira ditsala tse di ntshwa?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Katse e nnye e e sebete
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Likati lelalingu Bra-Cat lalifuna kakhulu kuya esikolweni. Bekati kutsi lapho utatitfolela labanyenti bangani. Kodvwa uNina abesolo amnatsisa ngelibhodlela. Kungabe loko kungamvimba yini Bra-Cat kutsi abe nebangani?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Kati Lomncane Lonesibindzi
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat o vha a ṱshi khou ṱoḓesa u ya tshikoloni nga maanḓa. U zwi ḓivha zwauri u ḓo wana khonani nnzhi henengei. Fhedzi Mmawe vho vha vha tshi khou nwa u bva kha aḽa maboḓelo hafhu. Izwo zwi nga thivhela Bra-Cat u ita dziṅwe khonani ntswa?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Tshimangana tsha Tshivindi
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Ubra-Cat wayetshiseka efuna ukuya esikolweni. Wayesazi ukuba, ukauba wayenokuya esikolweni wayenokufumana abahlobo abaninzi apho. Kodwa uMama wayewasela ezi bhotle zotywala kwakhona. Ingaba oko kungamthintela uBra-Cat ekufumaneni abahlobo abatsha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ikhalipha Lekatana Encinane
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat a swi lava ku ya exikolweni. Wa swi tiva leswaku u ta va na vanhana lavo tala kona. Kambe mahani a n'wa eka mabodlhela lamaya nakmbe. Xana sweswo swi ta endla leswaku Bra-Cat ku va a endla xinghana na vanghana lavantshwa?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ximanga Lexintsongo xa Nhenha
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Bra-Cat a swi lava ku ya exikolweni. Wa swi tiva leswaku u ta va na vanhana lavo tala kona. Kambe mahani a n'wa eka mabodlhela lamaya nakmbe. Xana sweswo swi ta endla leswaku Bra-Cat ku va a endla xinghana na vanghana lavantshwa?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ximanga Lexintsongo xa Nhenha
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Ubra-Cat wayefuna kabi ukuya esikoleni. Wayazi ukuthi wayengaba nabangane abaningi kabi lapho. Kodwa uMama ubephuza kulawo mabhodlela futhi. Ingabe kuyomnqanda lokho uBra-Cat ekwakehni abangane abasha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ikatshana Elinesibindi
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Ubra-Cat wayefuna kabi ukuya esikoleni. Wayazi ukuthi wayengaba nabangane abaningi kabi lapho. Kodwa uMama ubephuza kulawo mabhodlela futhi. Ingabe kuyomnqanda lokho uBra-Cat ekwakehni abangane abasha?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ikatshana Elinesibindi
Author: Mzamo Maqeba

Description: Hierdie storie gaan oor Sitronella, 'n dogtertjie wat nie kan hoor nie en niemand kan haar gesond maak nie. Haar familie stuur haar na Oupa Tambla wat haar ver, ver weg neem na 'n plek waar 'n mens nie net met jou ore hoor nie…\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Sitronella
Author: Carl de Sousa and Daniele Hitie

Description: Pale ena e bua ka Citronella, ngwanana e monyenyane ya sa utlweng,mme ha ho motho ya ka mo fodisang, Lelapa labo le mo romela ho ntatenoholo wa hae,ya ileng a mo isa tulong e hole-hole,moo o sa utlweng ka ditsebe fela…\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Citronella
Author: Carl de Sousa and Daniele Hitie

Description: Eli bali lingoCitronella,intombazanyana encinane eyayingeva kwaye kungekho nomnye umntu onokumyanga. Usapho lwakowabo lwamthumela kutat'omkhulu uTambala,nowahti wamthatha wamsa kwindawo ekude kakhulu,kwindawo apho ungeva ngeendlebe zakho kuphela... \r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ucitronella
Author: Carl de Sousa and Daniele Hitie

Description: Le ndaba ingoCitronella,intombazanyana eyayingezwa ezindlebeni. Wayengekho ongayisiza ayelaphe. Umndeni wayo wayisa kumkhulu wayo uTambala, owayithatha le ntombazanyana wayisa kude endaweni lapho kungadingeki ukutho umuntu ezwe ngezindlebe nje kuphela…\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ucitronella
Author: Carl de Sousa and Daniele Hitie

Description: The little girl in this book has a big problem: her house is overrun with all kinds of horrible monsters and they’re getting her into trouble!\r\n\r\nShe battles against them heroically, leaving lights on at night and splashing bath water to scare them away. But mum doesn’t understand why she behaves this way; she even thinks her daughter’s being naughty. Can you imagine!
Subtitle: null
Title: My Monster Mayhem
Author: Anita Pouroulis

Description: Die lewe in die veld kan baie eensaam wees,selfs vir Leon,die trotse jong leeukoning. Hy leer egter gou dat jy deur goedheid en vriendelikheid 'n lewenslange vriend kan kry.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Die Kleur van Liefde
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Ipilo ehlathini ingaba nesizungu khulu, nakuLeon,ikosi encani yebhubesi ezithanda khulu, kodwana wafunda masinyana bona ubuhle nobuntu kungakufumanela umngani wepilo yoke.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Umbala wethando
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Bophelo bja sekgweng bo ka ba bodutu kudu,ešita le go Leon tawana ya morena yeo ikgantšhago,eupša o phakiša go ithuta gore botse le botho di ka go hwetšiša mogwera wa nnete.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmala wa Lerato
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Bophelo ba morung bo ka ba bodutu haholo,eista le ho Leon,tau e nnyane ya morena e ikgantshang,empa o phakisa ithuta hore botle le mosa di ka o fumanstsha motswalle wa nnete.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmala wa Lerato
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Botshelo kwa sekgweng bo ka nna bodutu e le tota,tota le mo go Leon,tau ya kgosi e nnye e  e ikutlwang,fela o ithuta ka bonako gore go siama le go nna bonolo go ka go bonolo tsala ya botshelo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mmala wa Lerato
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Imphilo yasehlatsini kuyenteka ibe nesitunge ngisho nakuLeon, inkhosi lencane yelibhubezi. Kodvwa wafundza masinyane kutsi kulunga nemusa kungakudalela umngani wemphilo yakho yonkhe.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Umbala Welutsandvo
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Vhutshilo ḓakani vhu nga vha na vhuludu vhukuma,na kha Leon,khosi ṱhukhu ya dzindau ye ya vha I tshi ṱonga,fhedzi o tavhanya a guda zwauri zwivhuya na u luga zwi nga u wanisa konani ya tshoṱhe.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Muvhala wa Lufuno
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Vutomi bya le nhoveni byi nga va byi ri bya xivundza swinene,hambi a ri Leon,nghala leyintsongo ya manyunyu,kambe u halte a dyondza leswaku tintswalo na vunene swi nga ku kumela munghana wa vutomi bya wena.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Muhlovo wa Rirhandzu
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Kuba sithukuthezi kakhulu ngelinye ixesha ehlathini. Uleon naye,oyingonyama esencinci ezingcayo neyikumkani,ukhe abe nesithukuthezi,kodwa ukhawuleze wafunda ukuba ukulunga nokuba nobubele kungenza ukuba uzifumanele umhlobo wobomi.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Umbala wothando
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Kungaba nesizungu ukuphila ehlathini,ngisho kuLeon,inkosi yebhubesi encane eziqhehyayo,kodwa washeshe wafunda ukuthi ubumnene nokulunga kungakuzuzela abangane impilo yakho yonke.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Umbala Wothando
Author: Ntombizanele Nkence and Brendon Ruiters

Description: Rabbit and Father Snail are alone at home. What will the two of them get up to before Mama Sele returns from work?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Father Snail
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Kan Jy? Is 'n kleurvol geillustreerde,speelse en vrolike boekie wat jong lesers sal laat glimlag. 'Kielie jou maag' en Wikkel jou neus' is net twee van die pretdinge wat die kinders in hierdie boek doen. Die verhaal maak slim gebruik van herhaling en humor om jong kinders aan te moedig om te beweeg en te lees!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Kan jy?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: O ka kgona? Ke bujana e kgabisitssweng hanlte ,e tletseng papdi e bileng e thabisang,mme e tla etsa hore barutwana ba bososele. \"Tsikinyetsa dimpa\" le \"Famola dinko\" ke tse ding tsa dinthwana tse monate tseo bana ba bukeng ena ba di etsang. Pale ena e sebedisa phetapheto, maeetsisamodumo le tssehiso ka tsels e bohlale e le ho etsa hore bana ba banyane ba qalella ka ho bala!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: O ka kgona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Ungakwazi? Ibehukwana elicane elinezithombe, lomdlalo nelijabulisayo elizokwena abafundi abancane bamoyizele. \"Kitaza isisu\" no \"Nyakazisa ikhala\" ezinye zezinto ezijabulisayo ezenziwa yizingane kuleli bhuku. Indaba isenbizisa ukuphidaphinda, izenzukuthi nokuhlekisa ngendlela enobuhlakani ukwenza abantwana abancane banyakaze futhi bafunde!                                              \r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ungakwazi?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Ungakghona? Yincwadi etjengiswe ngendlela ekhanyileko,edlalisako nekarisako ezokwenza abafundi abancani bamoyizele. 'Kitaza amathumbu\" ne \"Sikinya ipumulo\" negezinye yezinto ezikarako ezenziwa beetwana encwadini le. Indaba le isebenzisa ukuphindaphinda,ukuduma kwamagama namahlaya ngendlela ehlakaniphileko ukwenza abentwana abancani basikinyeke bebafunde!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ungakghona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: O ka kgona? Ke pukwana ya lethabo ye e tletšego dipapadi, e swantšhitšwe ka go taga go dira gore babadi ba yona ba ba nnyane ba myemyele. \" Tsikinya dimpa\" le Famola dinko\" ke tše dingwe tša dilo tšeo bana ba di dirago ka mo pukung ye. Kanegelo ye e šomiša poeletso, maekiši le metlae ka tsela ya bohlale go dira gore bana ba ba nnyane ba itšhikinye ebile ba bapale.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: O ka kgona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: U nga kota? I buku leyintsongo leyi yi nga mpfampfarhutiwa yo nyyanyula na mitlango leyi yi nga ta endla vahlayi lavantsongo leswaku va n'wayitela. \" Dikida khirir ra wena\" na \"N'waya nhompfu ya wena\" I swin'wana swa swilo swo tsakisa leswi vana eka buku leyi va nga ta swi endla. Xitori xi tirhisa kuvuyelela na ku nyanyula hindela yo tirhisa swivulavulelo ku ta kota ku endla leswaku vana lavantsongo va ta lota ju tiola va hlaya!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: U nga kota?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Ungakwazi? Yincwadana yabantwana ehonjiswe kakuhle yaza yanemibala eqaqambileyo,inemidlalo yaye iyonwabisa nto leyo eza kwenza ukuba abafundi abaselula bancume bodwa xa beyifunda. \"Nyumbaza isisu\", 'Nyakazisa impumlo\" zezinye zezinto ezimnandi ezenziwa ngabafundi kule ncwadi. Ibali eli lisebenzise izaifanekisozwi, uphinda-phindo nokuhlekisa ngobuchule nangendlela eza kwenza ukuba abantwana bashuku-shkume ngexa befunda!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ungakwazi?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Can You? Is a brightly illustrated playful and happy little book that will make young readers smile. \"Tickle your tummy\" and Wiggle your nose\" are some of the fun things that the children in this book do. The story uses repetition and humour in a clever way to get young children moving and relaxing!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Can You?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wedny Hardie

Description: Ni nga kona? Ndi bugu ṱhukhu yo ṱanḓavhudzwaho zwavhuḓi, ya u tamba nahone I takadzho, ine ya ḓo ita uri vhavhali vhaṱuku vha nwenwele. \" Sengenedzani thumbu yaṋu\" na ' Sunyedzani ningo yaṋu\" ndi zwinwe zwa zwithu zwi takadzaho zwine vhana kha hei bugu vha ita. Tshiṱori tshi shumisa ndovhololo na u seisa nga nḓila yo ṱalifhaho u tela uri vhana vhaṱuku vha dzinginyee na u vhala!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ni nga kona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Ungakhona? Yincwajana ledvwetjwe ngembala logqamile, wekudlala nekujabulisa lotakwenta kutsi bantfwana bamamatseke. Bo: \"Kitalakita sisu sakho\" Nyakatisa imphumulo yakho\" nguletinye tetintfo letihlekisako letentiwa bantfwana kulencwajana. Lendzatjana isebentisa kuphindza,phindza,tentakutsi letihlekisako ngendlela lehakaniphile kuze bantfwana bashukume batewukhona kufundza!\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ungakhona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: A o ka kgona?  ke bukana ya metshameko le boitumelo,ya ditshwantsho tse di tsabakelang e e tla driang giore babuisi ba ba nnye ba nyenye. Go \"Tshikinya dimpa\" le go \"Famosa dinko\" ke Dipoeletso,maetsi le metlae di dirisiwa ka botlhale go anegela setori le go dira gore bana ba buise ba ntse ba tshameka.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: A o ka kgona?
Author: Carole Bloch and Wendy Hardie

Description: Hassie en Pappa Slak is alleen by die huis. Wat gaan die twee va hulle alles aanvang voordat Mamma Sele van die werk af kom?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Pappa Slak
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Ikhondlwana nobaba uKume basele bodwa ekhaya. Ababilaba bazokwenzani ngaphambili kobana uMma Sele abuye emsebenzini?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ubaba uKume
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Kgabutlana le Tate Kgopa ba noši ka gae. Naa bobedi ba ka dira eng,pele Mama Sele a boa mošomong?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Tate Kgopa
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Mmutla le Ntate Kgofu ba dutse ba le bang hae. Ebe ba ebe ba tla etsa dife he, pele Mama Sele a kgutla mosebetsing?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ntate Kgofu
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Mmutla le Rre Kgopa ba nosi kwa gae. Bodeding jwa bona ba tla ikaelela go dira eng pele Mme Sele a boa go tswa kwa tirong?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Rre Kgopa
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Mgwaja naBabe Mnenkhe babodvwa ekhaya. Batakwentani babobabili angakabuyi Make Sele emsebentini?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Babe Mnenkhe
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Muvhuda na Khotsi Vho-Khumba vha vhoṱhe hayani. Vhuvhili havho vha ḓo ita mini musi Mmne Vho-Sele vha saathu u vhuya mushumoni?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Khotsi Vho-Khumba
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: UMvundla kunye noTat'uNyekevu babehleli bodwa ekhaya. Ingaba yintoni le babefuna ukuyenza phambi kokuba uMama uSele abuye emsebenzini?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Utat'uNyekevu
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Mpfundla wa le kaya na Tatana Humba va voxe ekaya. Xana havambirhi ka vona ta endla yini loko Manana Sele a nga si vuya hi le ntirhweni?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Tatana Humba
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Unogwaja nobaba uMnenke babodwa ekhaya. Bazokwenzani bobaili ngaphambi kokuba umama uSele abuye emsebenzini?\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ubaba uMnenke
Author: Xolisa Guzulu and Turiya Magadlela

Description: Long, long ago, when Hippopotamus and Fire were friends, they would often play together. One Day, Fire visited Hippopotamus at his home and Hippopotamus learnt a very valuable lesson about playing with fire.
Subtitle: null
Title: How the Hippopotamus Lost it's Fur
Author: Jean Mabonyi; Jean Fullalove

Description: Tomas and Anneke came to stay at Makhulu's Bed and Breakfast. Everything was fine until Tomas lost his wallet. Lindiwe wanted to help find it, but everyone told her she was too young. They searched and couldn't find it. Lindiwe also searched.... till she found the wallet.
Subtitle: null
Title: Lindiwe our Hero
Author: Michelle Swartz

Description: Lank,lank gelede toe Seekoei en Vuur maats was,het hulle dikwels saam gespeel. Op 'n dag gaan kuier Vuur by Seekoei se huis en Seekoei leer 'n duur les oor wat gebeur wanneer jy met vuur speel.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Hoe die seekoei sy pels verloor het
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Ekadeni,lolokha uMvubu noMlilo babangani,babejayele ukudlala ndawonye. Ngelinye ilanga Umilo wavakatjhela uMvubu ekhaya lakhe,uMvubu wafunda isifundo esiqakatheke khulu sokudlala ngomilil.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Imvubu yalahlekelwa njani buboya bayo
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Kgalekgale,nakong ya ge Kubu le Mollo e sa le bakgotse,ba be ba fela ba raloka mmogo. Letšatši le lengwe Mollo a etela Kubu legaeng la gagwe, gomme Kubu a ithuta thuto e bohlokwa kudu gomme Kube a ithuta thuto e bohlokwa kudu mabapi le go raloka ka mollo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mokgwa wo kubu e lahlegetswego ke boya bja yona
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Kgale-Kgale ha kubu le mollo e le metswalle,ba ne ba atisa ha bapala mmoho. Ka tsatsi le leng mollo a etela kubu ha hae mme kubu a ithuta thuto ya bohlokwa mabapi le ho bapala ka mollo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ka moo kubu e lahlehetsweng ke boya ba yona
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: null
Subtitle: null
Title: Umtlhodlho
Author: M.S. Ntuli

Description: null
Subtitle: null
Title: Itsengo 4
Author: M.S. Ntuli

Description: Bogologolo tala fa Kubu le Molelo e ne e le ditsala,ba ne ba tlwaetse go tshameka mmogo. Letsatsi lengwe Molelo o ne etela Kubu kwa ga gagwe mme Kubu a ithutathuto e e botlhokwa ka go tshameka ka Molelo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Mokgwa o kuba e lathlhegetsweng ke boboa by yona
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Lokwa kadzeni emandvulo, ngesikhatsi iMvubu neMlilo basebangani, babevamise kudlala ndzawonye. Ngalelinye lilanga uMlilo wavakashela iMvubu ekhaya layo. Ngalelo langa iMvubu yafundza sifundvo lesibaluleke kabi lesimayelana nekudlala ngemlilo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Imvubu yalahlekelwa kanjani boya bayo
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Kale-kale,musi mvuvhu na Mulilo vha tshe dzikhonani,vho vha vha tshi anzela u tamba vhothe. Ḽinwe ḓ̭uvha Muloilo dalela Mvuvhu muḓini wawe nahone Nvuvhu a guda pfunzo khulwane nga ha u tamba nga Mulilo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Ndila ye mvuvhu ya xelelwa nga mamvele ngayo
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Umdlalo omfutshane otshatshele ngonxunguphalo olunamandla olungunozala wongquzulwano olusiphula izicithi. Umtshato ufaniswa nqwa nAmaza asisihloko sale ncwadi. A gripping short drama, filled with suspense and conflict. Problems in marriage are metaphorically referred to as Amaza.
Subtitle: null
Title: Amaza
Author: Z.S. Qangule

Description: Khale ka khaleni,loko Mpufuvu na Ndzilo va ha ri vanghana, a va tshama va ri karhi va tlanga swin'we. Siku rin'wana, ndzilo a endsela Mpfuvu ekaya ka yena,kutani Mpfuvu a dyondzo dyondzo leyikulu ya nkoka mayelana no tlanga hi Ndzilo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Leswi mpfuvu yi nga lahlekerisiwa xiswona hi voya bya yona
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description: Kudaladala kwamhla mnene,uMvumvu noMlilo babengabahlobo. Babethanda ukusoloko bedlala kunye. Ngenye imini uMlilo watyelela uMvubu. UMvubu wafunda isifundo esibaluleke kakhulu malunga nokudlala noMlilo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Yalahlekelwa kanjani buboya bayo imvubu
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description:
Le yidrama (okanye umdlalo) eyaziwayo nethandwa kakhulu eveza ukubaluleka
nokunyaniseka kokunxibelelana, kwaye ibonakalisa ukuba ukungathembeki kunye
nembeko engekhoyo kuyela kwingxabano, kwintlungu kunye nakukuphela
kobudlelwane. Iindlela zobuntu zolwazi kunye nembali nobubanzi bexabiso bobuntu
kwinto zasekuhlaleni ziyachazwa kummongo wamasiko nezithethe zakwaxhosa,
zenza ukuba ibenesiseko ekufundeni kubo bonke abafundi kunye
nokubalasela kokuzikhethela koncwadi kwizikolo.
This well-known and well-loved drama explores the vital importance of honest
communication, and how the absence of trust and respect leads to confl ict, hurt,
and the breakdown of relationships. The moving human experiences and the
broad spectrum of human and social issues addressed within the context of Xhosa
tradition make this valuable reading for all learners, and an excellent choice for
school literature.
This edition includes:
an informative introduction that reveals the topical issues that will attract learners
examples of questions and answers to help prepare for examinations.
Subtitle: null
Title: Amaza (approved for Grade 12)
Author: Z.S. Qangule

Description: Kudaladala lapho uMvubu noMililo babengabangani, babedlala ndawonye. Ngelinye ilanga uMilo wavakashela uMvubu ekhaya lakhe. UMvubu wafunda isifundo esibalulekile ngokudlala ngoMlilo.\r\n
Subtitle: null
Title: Bayilahlekela kanjani uboya bayo imvubu
Author: Jean Mbonyi and Jean Fullalove

Description:
Umbhali apha uyingene ngobuchule obummangalisayo imiphumela kaGawulayo
neNtsholongwane yakhe. Uyidandalazisa elubala ngobuchule bolwimi lwesiXhosa into
yokuba imfundo yakho, impumelelo yakho ingalikrele eliyingozi kuwe, ukuba ngaba
akukwazi ukuzibamba apha emhlabeni okanye uziphathe ngokufanelekileyo. Umbhali
uyalumkisa uluntu kuyilo lwakhe lwencwadi.
In this enthralling drama, the author delves extensively into the consequences of
misbehaving in relationships and the most tragic consequence of all: HIV/AIDS.
The playwright’s deft use of rich language, idioms and proverbs
clearly defi ne how education, success and morals can ironically
